83968.name: Kobold Feats and Mutants
83968.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you sick of every kobold warrior starting with the Alertness feat? Wishing your little reptilian pawns could be descended from dinosaurs rather than dragons? If you're looking for new tricks for your kobolds to try against your players, we've got a few you might want to try on for size.

83969.name: Big Cheese
83969.description:
The cheese is 12 inches high, 8 inches across and 9 inches thick at the base.

From the box; 'A Giant Slice of fun. Manoeuvre your marbles up the 'Cheese' mountain. It takes skill to be the first'.

It looks like the marbles are pulled up the cheese mountain using a harness attached to the top of the cheese - pulled by strings at the bottom sides. I've only seen this game in a toy museum.

Each player gets four marbles and a mouse. A marble is put onto the mouse and then you have to carry that marble to the top, using a cord that acts as a lever and pulley. If you drop the marble, then you must go back to the base of the cheese and try again on your next turn. The first player to get 4 marbles to the top, wins.

83970.name: Rats in the Walls (d20)
83970.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dire rats and wererats make good d20 Fantasy adversaries, both because of the strong reactions they provoke from people and because the evocative (and often disgusting) locations in which they are often found are interesting places to fight. From new options such as the deadly tail fighting feat, the crippling curse of gutgnaw or the supernatural powers of the Rattenkonig, Rats in the Walls offers all the tools you need to give rats and their kin a starring role in your campaign.

83971.name: Rise of the Ghouls
83971.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghouls get a harsh deal in d20 Fantasy. Rise of the Ghouls gives you new feats, abilities and ghoulish variants, all designed to give these overlooked and under-appreciated undead a chance to shine.

83972.name: Troll Races and Champions
83972.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masterwork Monsters: Troll Races and Champions presents four new troll sub-races, and a fast-and-easy template for creating trollspawned creatures. It also contains four new prestige classes specifically designed for troll characters.

83973.name: Serawek: World of Tides
83973.description:
From publisher blurb:

Serawek is a regular spot on many trade routes and a favorite among tourists and travelers seeking a momentary respite from the world of space. Yet behind the peaceful image of wide beaches and tropical resorts, Serawek is a planet driven by strong tides and storms.

83974.name: Twenty Treasures: Exotic Magic Weapons
83974.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twenty Treasures: Exotic Magic Weapons provides a series of unique magic or psionic options for each of the nineteen exotic weapons found in the core D20 game.

83975.name: On the Hoof: D20 Riding Beasts
83975.description:
From publisher blurb:

The updated edition of On the Hoof: d20 Riding Beasts contains 14 new and unusual mounts for d20 fantasy campaigns. From the Alvacoom to Wizzletop's Demiphant, these beasts are designed with the express intent of getting players off their ponies and onto these more vibrant additions. Finding and taming these beasts can be an adventure in itself. This collection includes balanced and playtested mounts appropriate for high-level play. Riding constructs, oozes, and race-specific beasts are also included, and open up many possibilities for the GM or player.

83976.name: Instant GM: A Bag of Tricks
83976.description:
From publisher blurb:

The players have to constantly adlib and adapt to plot developments. If they become overwhelmed, it is “in character” to stop and discuss the situation with each other. The Game Master on the other hand has no confidants. He is expected to react instantly to what the players describe their characters doing.

The typical GM spends hours preparing before a game; planning for everything the characters might try. But no matter how much you prepare, the only sure bet is that the players will think of something you didn’t. In fact the more material you prepare, the more likely it is that one of the players will latch on to an incidental detail and take off in an unexpected direction faster than you can say “Red Herring.”

Every Game Master has his own style. But all of them need to be able to think on their feet. Improvising during a game is easier if you are ready to step away from the written game and go in the direction the players want to try. Remember the player characters are the main characters in the story you are telling. By definition the plot is what they do, not what you planned for them. You want to gently guide the group ‘back on track’ without letting them realize that they ever deviated from the script.

There are three techniques which can improve your improvisation behind the GM screen: Plot Seeds, Stock Characters, and Rakugo Props. (On a personal note: Some of the best games I’ve ever run, I’ve shown up at the table armed only with this bag of tricks and no fore planning to get in the way.)

83978.name: Digging Around in the Dirt
83978.description:
From the Introduction

"This set of rules allows you and a few mates to go rummaging around in old ruins looking for sacred texts, the Hair Lip of St. Ravell, treasures of a lost age or just about anything else you fancy. Most of all, it gives you a set of simple, fast and enjoyable skirmish rules for the late medieval or renaissance period. There is also, dare I say it, an additional section which allows for more horrifying encounters in the ruins. Not for everyone, I know, but we enjoyed them and I hope that you do too.

To play, you will need 2d10 and 2d6, a ruler marked in inches, two or more sets of around 8-10 figures and some sort of ruin or building model."

User Summary

These relatively simple rules cover both combat and searching for items in the ruins. Rules set includes melee and ranged attacks, armor values, morale, etc. Each side gets a pool of points with which to buy a small skirmishing force. Each unit gets outfitted with armor and weaponry (with more effective items costing more). Set also comes with an appendix for Horror/Fantasy game play, which introduces undead creatures, spell casting, etc.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #161 (February 2001)

83980.name: Pendragon
83980.description: The 5th Century - the Eagle of Rome has retreated from British shores. British tribes are surrounded on all sides by Saxons, Picts, and the Irish. The fiercely independent tribes must elect a high king, the Pendragon, to unite them under a single banner. Will you be the leader strong enough to claim this crown? Pendragon is a conflict-based worker placement game for three to six players. Each warlord builds both the size of his army and his stronghold while actively paying tribute to the British tribes which serve as the main source of champions for his forces. Build the largest army, secure the support of the tribes, and seize the crown at the legendary Giants' Dance.

83981.name: Medici
83981.description:
User Summary

Medici is the iPhone and iPad adaptation of the classic auction board game by Reiner Knizia. The iOS version contains AI, hotseat multiplayer, and streamlined play.

83982.name: Police Simulator
83982.description:
You are a police chief in control of the police force of a European city. Co-ordinate police cars, police helicopters, detectives and forensic teams to make sure law and order is maintained and no crime goes unpunished!

Police Simulator
A blend of simulation and real-time strategy!

Monitor your force with the help of a detailed and realistic city map and be prepared to react to any event that takes place in your city. On the streets you will encounter during the day and night, exciting, spectacular and realistic operational scenarios - from car chases to riots! A cool head and a well-planned strategy are essential!

Keep an eye on the cases you've got active. Hire and train Crime Scene Investigators (CSI) to go out and gather evidence.

Recruit (and train) the best Detectives to make use of the evidence to complete their investigation and discover who done it!

Then send your police force to apprehend the villain!

Keep the morale and health of your team at the forefront of your mind - only if your police officers are fresh and focused on the job, can they cope with the daily pressure.

Make sure that respectable citizens can go about their activities without fear!

As police chief you must manage not only the equipment, training and deployment of your police officers, but also the daily administrative duties at Police Headquarters. Experience the exciting task of running your own Police!

Features
- A blend of simulation and real-time strategy
- Fight crime in a modern, realistic European city
- Variety of buildings, such as Airport, Stadium and distinctive districts, such as industrial, financial, slums and suburbs
- Spectacular missions such as "chase", "riots", "robbery" and much more
- Day / night cycle which effects the behavior of the population (different traffic density and fluctuating crime rate)
- Manage your staff, create operational plans and buy new equipment
- Train your force to improving their skills
- Extensive career mode with various levels of difficulty
- Realistic sound design, police radio, Sirens and background noise

Source: The Publisher Website.

83983.name: Theatre of War 2: Kursk 1943
83983.description:
The largest tank battle in history - KURSK 1943!

Theatre of War 2: Kursk 1943 is a completely new real-time strategy (RTS) game in the Theatre of War series of tactical World War II titles. It does not require any of the previous games (such as Africa 1943) to play!

The Battle of Kursk lasted for forty-nine days, from July 5 until August 23, 1943 and has made its way into history as one of the most crucial conflicts of WWII. It was the last armoured strategic offensive the Germans were able to mount in the east. The resulting decisive Soviet victory gave the Red Army the strategic initiative for the rest of the war.

Assuming the role of either the Russian or German battle group commander, acting under direct orders of division commanders Ivan Chistyakov or Walter Hoernlein, players will control their troops in historical scenarios on precisely reconstructed authentic battlefields.

Five Days of July
In Theatre of War 2: Kursk 1943, you control the units of the battle group belonging to German division Grossdeutschland or the forces of the Soviet 67th Guards Rifle Division and 3rd Mechanized Corps, which participated in the defensive stage of the Kursk battle at the south face of the Kursk salient. There are two campaigns - German and Soviet:

· Fiery Salient (forces of the Soviet 6th Guards and 1st Tank Army, July 5-10, 1943)
· Operation Citadel (German division Grossdeutschland Kampfgruppe, July 5-10, 1943)

Each campaign consists of up to 9 major battles and puts you in charge of a typical military unit from that period. Each soldier is a unique personality with specific characteristics and skills that can change during the campaign. Careful planning and force selection are recommended before each battle.

Key features
· Take control over a powerful Soviet or German battle group in one of the battles which changed the history of the war;
· Fully simulated visibility, ballistics and armor penetration systems. All vital vehicle systems and crew members are individually modelled;
· Two historical campaigns (up to 18 major engagements in total) and an unlimited number of customisable missions waiting to be created with a few mouse clicks using the built-in Mission Generator;
· Sophisticated AI for both enemy and your own units;
· Over 60 Soviet, German and lend-leased US and British player-controllable units (not counting various infantry squads);
· Unsurpassed management of your soldiers. You can assign, promote and award up to several thousand soldiers with their unique characteristics. You can even rename units for easier recognition in the heat of battle;
· Team multiplayer for up to 8 players (control of key points or assault/defence) with reinforcements, artillery barrages and air strikes;
· Tools for creating your own missions and maps (built-in Mission Generator, wizard-like Simple Editor, full-blown Mission Editor and 3D Map Editor).

Source: The Publisher Website.

83984.name: Theatre of War 2: Africa 1943
83984.description:
Theatre of War: Africa 1943 covers the events of 1943 in Tunisia, North Africa. Recovering from their losses after the crushing defeat and subsequent retreat after the Second Battle of El-Alamein, the German Afrika Korps - reinforced and now supported by the Italian Army - prepare once more to put steel against steel with the Allies. The Axis forces, under the command of the legendary General Erwin Rommel, have an all too brief opportunity to seize victory from the clutches of their earlier failures.

Players will lead Rommel's Afrika Korps in their last full-scale military campaign and command the English and American armies as they try to push the Axis forces out of Africa once and for all.

The stage is set, it's time again to enter the Theatre of War!

Three Campaigns

There are three campaigns, one for each side of the conflict: Germany, USA and UK. In several missions the German troops are reinforced by Italian forces. In total, there are 15 missions.

Available Campaigns:

Flaming "Torch" (U.S. forces, February 14 to 25, 1943)
Last Step to Victory (British forces, February 20 to March 6, 1943)
Last Offensive (Italo-German forces, February 14 to 25, 1943)

Features

· Real-time Strategy gameplay
· Highly detailed simulation of World War 2 combat
· House to house urban combat
· Animated hand-to-hand fighting
· Anti-air vehicles and stationary anti-aircraft mounts to control
· Smoke screens
· Different types of trenches, sand bags, road blocks and barbed wire emplacements are available (to defending units only) and can be placed by the player before the battle starts
· Advanced unit formations control
· Advanced visual spotting system accounts for observation angles and smoke screens
· Online Game Server Browser
· 15 missions in three campaigns - German, American and British - including famous battles such as Kasserine Pass, Sidi Bou Zid, Sbeitla and Tebessa.
· Mission Editor to create your own scenarios
· Interactive Tactical Battle Map
· Over 50 different vehicle types

Source: The Publisher Website.

83985.name: Kobold Quarterly (Issue 14 - Summer 2010)
rpgissuearticle: Ancient Tongues: Fantasy Languages for a Fantasy World
Ask the Kobold: Bleeding, Invisibility, Suggestion and Lines of Effect
Courtly Games of the Wizard Prince
Free City of Zobeck: Birdfolk of Zobeck
Men of Honor: Alternate Paladin Codes
83985.description:
Theme: Treasure

Included in the issue:

FEATURES
> Aasimar (Kolja Raven Liquette) - The blood of heaven runs in these veins.
> Prince of Wolves (James L. Sutter) - The Pathfinder novels begin with a big, big smile.
> The Ecology of the Tengu (R. William Thompson, James Jacobs) - Mimics, guardians, bladematers; tengu are complex creatures.
> Healing Hands (James Graham) - New paladin powers to answer the players of the purest knights.
> Perfumes of Bourgund (Stefen Strysky) - The smell of magic is surprisingly strong.
> Skill Blades (Matthew J. Henson) - Taking 4th Edition skill challanges into combat!

CHARACTERS

> Figurines of Wondrous Power (Phillip Larwood)

83986.name: Canabalt
83986.description:
User Summary

You control a man running along the rooftops of a city that is crumbling from an alien attack. You are trying to avoid falling down. This game was programmed in five days as part of an indie game challenge.

83987.name: Aether
83987.description:
Aether is a video game designed by Edmund McMillen and Tyler Glaiel and published by Armor Games. Released on September 3, 2008, it can be played for free online or downloaded for offline play. Players control a lonely boy and an octopus-like monster that the boy encounters, solving puzzles on different planets to restore them from monochrome to color. The pair travel through space by swinging on clouds and asteroids with the monster's elongated tongue, searching other planets for life to which the boy can relate.

McMillen and Glaiel created the game and developed it in 14 days. Both developers expressed interest in seeing a version being released on the Wii game console through the WiiWare online service. Aether received a positive response from video game blogs for its unusual visual style and atmosphere. The single looped piece of background music received a mixed response and the controls were highlighted as an area of the game that could have been improved before release.

Source: Wikipedia, "Aether (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83988.name: The Ship
83988.description:
From the Distributor's website

The Ship is primarily a multiplayer, online murder game with a unique set of game rules.

The Ship is owned by the mysterious Mr X and as one of many 'lucky' recipients of a free ticket you arrive on board The Ship to find there's a catch to your luxury cruise.

You are coerced into a brutal Hunt to indulge Mr. X's fantasies, under threat of death for not only yourself, but also your family. Your only chance to save yourself and your family is to play the Hunt and win.

83989.name: GrailQuest
83989.description:
user comment

MicroQuest #3 in the Metagaming MicroQuests series, this is a programmed adventure for Melee and Wizard, and suitable for Advanced Melee and Advanced Wizard.

The box includes a rulebook with 13 pages of rules and 19 pages for the programmed adventure. Also included is a sheet of counters that you cut apart yourself, and a d6.

From the back of the box:

"Dare you seek the Holy Grail....

The Knights of the Round Table are one of mythology's shining examples of sacrifice and honor. When King Arthur calls on the heroes of Camelot to go forth and seek the Last Supper's Holy Grail, you are there. You go forth with them on Christendom's greatest quest. He who finds the blessed Grail must be of purity, honor and courage. There is no adventure more worthy of chivalry's finest flower, no greater way to grace.

GrailQuest is a programmed fantasy adventure that can be played solitaire. You are one of King Arthur's Knights of the Round Table. You create your character, equip him with armor and weapons, and send him forth on the great quest. Monsters, danger and death await, traits of flesh and spirit the seeker must endure."

83990.name: Treasure of the Silver Dragon
83990.description:
From the back of the box:

"$10,000.00 cash for you....

A 31-ounce solid sterling silver dragon is hidden in the United States. Information needed to find the silver dragon is in this programmed fantasy adventure. The person who actually finds the silver dragon gets to keep it and claim a $10,000.00 cash prize from Metagaming. If it has not been found by September 1, 1985, a drawing will be held from cards in this adventure that have been mailed to Metagaming. Any of you might win.
...
Metagaming brings you a real live treasure hunt! This isn't just reading and playing about treasures. Perhaps you will be the first to decipher the clues and go get the silver dragon and win $10,000.00. It's all up to you. You may be the one to hold that dragon in your hands knowing you beat thousands to it."

83991.name: Master of the Amulets
83991.description:
user comment

This is MicroQuest 7 in the Metagaming series. Unlike other products in the series, this is not a programmed adventure where you look up paragraphs in a book. It includes an adventure map showing mountains, forests, rivers, etc., and rules for generating random encounters as players explore the map searching for the amulets. It also includes rules for negotiating with enemies instead of fighting.

From the back of the box:

"Dirringar was the Black Council's most powerful Wizard. Yet he wanted more. He created cursed amulets for his enemies and mystic amulets for himself. When Dirringar activated the Great Amulet he'd gain power over all. But, the Black Council's conjuring exploded the Great Amulet, scattering lesser amulets across Dirringar's Lost Valley.

Legend holds that Dirringar's mystic amulets may still be sought by the brave or foolish. It's even said that Dirringar's gates can be controlled and the valley's entrance gained by his amulets. The brave may seek, the clever find and the lucky escape. Power awaits, can you take it?"

83992.name: Security Station
83992.description:
user comment

This is MicroQuest #5 in the Metagaming MicroQuests series of programmed adventures for Melee and Wizard. It has a light science-fiction setting.

From the back of the box (minus several spelling errors):

"Jas N'orn was Cidri's most renowned collector of the weird and bizarre. He had the most, yet wanted more.... Mnoren gates to a ruined Earth gave Jas his chance: nuclear genocide had rained down on the world's green hills. Burrowing in the rubble, Jas' searchers found a functioning remnant. Its technology was strange and its secrets dangerous. Jas knew he must have it. Such was the way that the mystery and death of the Security Station came to Cidri's past. With the Mnoren gone, it now kills on alone.

Security Station is a programmed fantasy adventure that can be played solitaire or by a group. You become a treasure seeker in a menacing relic of Earth's atomic demise. Great secrets and immense wealth await the brave invaders of this strange place. Create and equip your character and with a group of hardy friends, you will step into the pulsating curtain of multi-colored lights. There is no turning back, an adventure of fear and intrigue has begun."

83993.name: Masques
83993.description:
From the back of the book :

You'll find in this book :
- a complete guide of Venice
- a description of the "Compagnons de Janus"
- new player aids for Athanor RPG
- a large campaign in Venice

"Venise en 2306. Alors que les cérémonies du Boulier vont commencer, le carnaval bat son plein. Les Arlequins et les Colombines se pourchassent de passerelles en passerelles, au-dessus des ruelles inondées de la Cité des Doges.
Autour de la Place Saint-Marc, des jeunes gens en costumes noir et blancs distribuent des tracts invitant à la communion universelle, tandis que discrètement on évacue de l'un des casinos une personne dont le coeur n'a pas résisté aux Simulateurs de réalité..."

83994.name: Ducktales: Tesouro da Pirâmide
83994.description:
Uncle Scrooge, Huey, Dewey and Louie Duck, Gyro Gearloose and Launchpad McQuack travel to Mexico to search for QuetzalQuac Treasure. They must climb a pyramid, fight monsters and find precious itens.
The Pyramid is a 3D board with four stores. Each player must roll a die, advance his character to the square and do the action indicated by it (if any). There is a dial used to resolve battles that occur when a door is reached.
The goals of the game are: find the two halfs of a map, a lucky amulet, the QuetzalQuac treasure and go back to the base of the pyramid.

83995.name: College Slam
83995.description:
From the back of the box:

Welcome to the College Slam arena! The crowd's on their feet...over 40 college teams, cheerleaders...fight songs...all the rivalry...all the madness! There's a wild dunk...the backboard shatters! This is the slammingest hoops action ever...and there's more...head-to-head, tournament, and season-long play! College Slam is gonna take you to school.

Customize and save your players and stats!
Shatter the backboard!
Make lightning strike!
The road ends here!
Storm the defense with the whirlwind!
Slammin' dunks and alley-oops!
Up to 16 players - it's tournament time!

83996.name: The Combatribes
83996.description:
The Combatribes​ (ザ・コンバットライブス) is a 1990 Beat 'em Up released for the arcades by Technos Japan Corp (the developers of Renegade and Double Dragon). A home version for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System was also released in 1992. The game centers around three vigilantes (identified as cyborgs in the SNES port) who must fight against numerous street gangs in New York. The SNES version was released for the Wii Virtual Console in North America on November 30, 2009.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Combatribes," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83997.name: The Death and Return of Superman
83997.description:
From the back of the box:


Brace yourself for a hard-hitting fight to the finish that lets you relive the classic DC comic book series!
As Superman, fight for your life against mighty Doomsday, the vile distributor of death and destruction!
Then, control the destiny of the four Supermen--each claiming to be the one true Superman!
Explode through 10 levels of super-powered battles and fly at furious speeds--until only the real Superman is left standing!

83998.name: D-Force
83998.description:
From the back of the box:

You've got the fastest bird to be had, but we're not sure you can handle it. If you're quick enough, you'll command the latest Nuclear Apache Helicopter, D-Force, through 7 bone-crushing levels. You'll roam six countries on your seemingly endless search for a powerful oil-rich Mid-Eastern Dictator. If you fail, we'll all be learning a new language soon! Comprende?
We've created the most intense, physically demanding game around! With selectable weapons, quick zoom, 16 bit graphics, and a massive 8 MEG game pak, we don't want to hear any whining. D-Force utilizes thousands of colors and special effects, giving you the ultimate test on the Super NES.
D-Force is nearly impossible & downright unforgettable!

83999.name: DinoCity
83999.description:
From the back of the box:

TEAM UP WITH THE DINOSAURS FOR A SUPER-HUGE ADVENTURE!

Uh oh, you've just been launched into the prehistoric age by a whacko TV monitor, and the biggest thing going is dinosaurs! Luckily, the dinosaurs have a huge liking for time travellers like you and your friend. Now you just have to solve the problem of the Neanderthals. These cave heads are out to destroy "DinoCity" - and all the dinosaurs in it. So hop on the back of your favorite dinosaur, and get ready for some fast-action fun on a very LARGE scale.

84000.name: The Flintstones: The Rescue of Dino & Hoppy
84000.description:
The Flintstones: The Rescue of Dino & Hoppy is a 1991 video game developed by Taito for the Nintendo Entertainment System based on The Flintstones TV series.

The gameplay is preceded by a short movie which sets the stage. A man from the 30th century kidnaps Dino and Hoppy, the two pets the Flintstones and the Rubbles. Dino belongs to Fred and Wilma, and Hoppy is the pet of Barney and Betty. Fred's alien friend, Gazoo, lost parts of his time machine due to the evil man from the future. Gazoo is only visible to Fred. With each stage Fred completes, he earns back another piece of the time machine, and Gazoo wields together the pieces progressively. Throughout the stages, Fred runs into Wilma, Barney, Betty, as well as George Jetson in the future stage. Fred has to defeat a boss at each stage. At the end of the map, he gets the last piece and travels to the future, where he has to defeat the man from the 30th century.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Flintstones: The Rescue of Dino & Hoppy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83501.name: Dragons
83501.description:
From the Back Cover:

This publication was designed to be used with any fantasy or science fiction game. Welcome to the Varanae series of books. We hope the dragons in this edition will increase the interest and excitement of your game.

The description of each dragon will help you understand the personality of each dragon and ways it can be played.


User Summary:

This book contains images and descriptions of 50 different dragons.

83503.name: Monstrum I
83503.description:
Form the Introduction:

Welcome to the Varanae series of books. We hope the monsters in this edition will increase the interest and excitement of your game. This publication was designed to be used with any fantasy or science fiction game.
The description of each creature will help you understand the personality of each one and ways is can be played. However these are only guides and the personality of each creature can be changed by the Referee.

User summary:

This book contains images and descriptions of 100 different creatures.

83504.name: Miser's Hoard (Issue 2)
83504.description:
Cover by "Rick"

Contents

A Dungeon Master's Guide by Pete Walker
Pandora's Box
The Jade Cat by John McKeown
Outpost — An idea for a SF adventure by Simon Maybury
The Hoard: New magic items by John McKeown
Letters Page

On The Rack: Imagine Magazine by John McKeown
Fanzine Reviews by John McKeown

83505.name: Miser's Hoard (Issue 3)
83505.description:
Published just after "Finals" 1983.

Contents

Heroism and Humanity by John McKeown
The Jade Cat part 2 by John McKeown
Postbag
On The Rack
The Cult of Genert by John E. Watkins
Magazine Reviews

83508.name: DragonLords (Issue 17)
rpgissuearticle: Cop Out Time For Fantasy Purists...
Dragonlords - An Interview with Mike Lewis?!
83508.description:
User summary:

British Fantasy 'zine. No table of contents and no credits other than the two editors and author bylines.

Article Listing

Editorial by Ian Marsh, Mike Lewis
Starships & Psychopaths by Andy King
MythCon '83 by Matt Quartermain
Potions by Richard Lee

Beyond the Toon by Hudson Shaw
DragonLords: an interview with Mike Lewis ?! by Ian Marsh
Letters
Zine For Bed...
VOP.... by I. Gibbs
Torture by James Manktelow
Reviews by Mike Lewis
Pavis
Scorpion Hall

83509.name: Chivalry Lives
83509.description:
From the Introduction:

The Scenario: A test of the peoples of the world we know. Creatures from another land wish to know if their values of patience and kindness are common to this place. They are seeking cultural exchange possibilities. Can the party of adventurers demonstrate higher standards of wisdom and compassion while confronting the unknown?

83510.name: Kabal Magic Spells
83510.description:
User Summary

A collection of spells for the game Knights and Berserskers and Legerdemain.

83511.name: The Palladium Book of European Castles
83511.description:
From the Introduction

This book was designed to be used by fantasy gamers who wish to use detailed descriptions of castles in their campaigns. All of the buildings depicted in this book are, or were, actual castles of European origin. They can easily be used in any fantasy campaign as is or can be modified as the players see fit.

videogame: Afrika Korps vs. D-Day Special Edition
83514.name: Desert Rats vs. Afrika Korps
videogamecompilation: Afrika Korps vs. D-Day Special Edition
83514.description:
Desert Rats vs. Afrika Korps is a real time strategy game that is based on the North Africa Campaign of World War II. The single player missions are playable as the German Afrika Korps or the British Desert Rats. There is also an option for online multiplayer.

Source: Wikipedia, "Desert Rats vs. Afrika Korps," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83517.name: Mission Barbarossa
83517.description:
User Summary

Mission Barbarossa is an expansion for the Windows game Blitzkrieg. The title adds a new campaign of nine missions and two further historical battles. All the data and the organization of the units were created with a tactical and realistic point of view. The expansion also adds 28 new units.

83519.name: Blitzkrieg Anthology
83519.description:
User Summary

A compilation boxset of the original Blitzkrieg title and its 2 expansions, Blitzkrieg: Rolling Thunder and Blitzkrieg: Burning Horizon.

83522.name: DragonLords (Issue 18)
83522.description:
"Special Botties, Boobs and Bondage Issue!!!"

User Summary:

Article List

Waffle by Mike Lewis
Take That You Zine! by Mike Lewis
Confusion: Dragonmeet VI by Ian Marsh
The Dragon Lords Song
Letters Letters Letters
The Wizard's Quest by Steven Sturt
Beyond The Toon by Hudson Shaw

The Dragonlords Crusaders I by M. Tabery
Timeship
C & S by Mike Lewis
The Snow King's Bride: Soloquest 3 by Ian Marsh
Games (Diplomacy)
City of Sorcerors by Ian Marsh

83523.name: Blitzkrieg II: Fall of the Reich
83523.description:
User Summary

Blitzkrieg 2: Fall of the Reich is a strategy game on the PC. Expanding Blitzkrieg 2, the title allows you to explore two new campaigns (one with the Germans and the other one with the Soviets) which take place at the end of the Second World War, the summer, 44 and in spring, 1945. An 8-player multiplayer mode via LAN or internet is also available.

83524.name: Blitzkrieg 2: Liberation
83524.description:
Game website:

Blitzkrieg 2: Liberation is a stand-alone expansion to the critically-acclaimed WWII RTS - Blitzkrieg 2. The updated gameplay in Blitzkrieg 2: Liberation focuses on new strategic opportunities, war on a global scale and exciting battles.

In Blitzkrieg 2: Liberation, players will take command of the US Army or German Wehrmacht as they plan massive operations and lead their men into fierce action. Players must carefully select reinforcements and use a wide range of new weapons in two expansive campaigns across a variety of landscapes. A new graphics engine and significant technical advances over the original game place you in control of the most dramatic and bloody conflict of the past century.

The ultimate World War II RTS experience continues in Blitzkrieg 2: Liberation!

FEATURES
Fight as the United States or Germany
Plan your actions strategically by choosing the order in which to fight battles and complete missions
Control of more than 250 authentic WWII units and 60 types of infantry
Units gain experience and new skills, enhancing their tactical use on the battlefield
Protect your troops by using cover provided by structures, or destroy those same structures to flush out the enemy
Experience intense WWII battles in a stunning fully rendered 3D interactive environment
Online (Internet) play supports multiplayer match-making and auto-rating support along with dedicated servers

videogame: Sega Genesis Classic Collection: Gold Edition
83525.name: Decap Attack
videogamecompilation: Sega Genesis Classic Collection: Gold Edition
83525.description:
Decap Attack, a westernised version of the Japanese game Magical Hat no Buttobi Tabo! Daibōken (まじかるハットのぶっとびターボ！大冒険 Majikaru Hatto no Buttobi Tabo! Daibōken?), is a video game for the Mega Drive/Genesis console. The game is also a part of the Sega Genesis Collection (Sega Mega Drive Collection) for the PlayStation 2 and PlayStation Portable and Sonic's Ultimate Genesis Collection (Sega Mega Drive Ultimate Collection) for Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3. It is almost identical in terms of gameplay to the Japanese title Magical Hat Flying Turbo Adventure. However, the graphics, characters and level designs were nearly all changed, since Flying Turbo Adventure was based on the anime series Magical Hat for which the license was not obtained outside of Japan. Both are updates of the Master System game Psycho Fox, and also the NES game Kid Kool.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decap_Attack,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogame: Sega Genesis Classic Collection: Gold Edition
83526.name: Flicky
videogamecompilation: Sega Genesis Classic Collection: Gold Edition
83526.description:
Flicky is an arcade game made by Sega. First released in arcades in 1984, Flicky was also released at the time for the SG-1000, and then ported to the MSX and Japanese computers Sharp X1, Fujitsu FM-7 and NEC PC-8801. It was later ported to the Sega Mega Drive/Genesis in 1991. Flicky was designed by Yoji Ishii, who was with Sonic Team until August 1999, when he formed Artoon, his own company.

Flicky has since been re-released as part of the Sonic Mega Collection for the Nintendo GameCube, Sonic Mega Collection Plus for the Xbox and PlayStation 2 where it was an unlockable extra game, and in Sega Genesis Collection (Sega Mega Drive Collection outside of North America) for the PlayStation 2 and PSP. It has also been released for mobile phones.

Flicky next appears in Sonic's Ultimate Genesis Collection for Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 (Sega Mega Drive Ultimate Collection outside of North America).

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flicky,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83527.name: DragonLords (Issue 19)
83527.description:
Article List

Chew You To Bits by Marc Gascoigne
W-W-What's Up, Doug? by Doug Cowie
MythCon 1983 by Matt Quartermain
Review: Lair of the Scarlet Elite by Matt Quartermain

They Don't Know by Ian Marsh

83529.name: GodFinger
83529.description:
User Summary

GodFinger is a Apple OS game developed by Wonderland Software. The player takes the role of a god in control of their own planet. The goal of the game is to level up your powers by building structures and cultivating your planet’s civilization. There are a number of wonders available for the player to use that can either aid or hinder a civilization’s growth. Converting followers to your religion or building structures will earn gold which can unlock additional features. Friends’ worlds can be added to your galaxy to allow interaction between players online as well. The game emphasizes micro-transactions, as there is a limited ability to perform actions in a short period of time. Additional resources can be purchased to complete extra actions using real currency.

83530.name: Quasits & Quasars (Issue 10) / DragonLords (Issue 20)
83530.description:
A joint issue of both DragonLords #20 and Quasits & Quasars #10

Article List

Editorial by Ian Marsh

Doug & Friends by Doug Cowie
Sleigh Wars by Chris Elliot & Dik Edwards
The Dragonlords Crusaders 3

Snowmen as Player Characters

Endless Plans

83532.name: DragonLords (Issue 21)
83532.description:

Now look here Mike, you really can't do this to me again! Ian

83533.name: Kobolds Ate My Baby! (Third Edition!)
83533.description:
From back cover:
In Kobolds Ate My Baby! Third Edition, you become Kobolds (short, furry cannon-fodder with a penchant for gluttony and mayhem). Your mission is to steal babies from the nearby towns, so that King Torg (ALL HAIL KING TORG!) can have them for dinner. Along the way you'll learn forbidden magick, battle blood-thirsty chickens, worship The Big Red God, get killed by Random Horrible Deaths(TM), and cook your friends for dinner!

Completely revised and updated to use the BEER ENGINE! Bear and Pretzels Role-Playing Game System, KAMB3E is faster, funnier, and easier to use than previous editions. This book has everything that you need to get started, including: kobold generation rules, a quick and easy rules engine, magick spells and other gear that Kobolds have stolen, a starter adventure, and a slew of absolutely ridiculous House Rules!

83535.name: Sindbad and the Demon Pumpkin
83535.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The world is of full of wonder--and danger--and Sindbad is about to find out just how full. Join the legendary sailor and his crew as they seek fortune and glory in the fabulous lands of East Africa. Sindbad and the Demon Pumpkin is an adventure for Hex Games’ The Adventures of Sindbad and its sourcebook Mountains of the Moon: Sindbad in East Africa.

83536.name: Hotel Tycoon Resort
83536.description:
User Summary

Hotel Tycoon Resort is a mobile game that places the player in control of a number of resorts. The main character is dating a girl whose father is a hotel magnate. The father insists that you be able to manage a hotel chain if you want to marry his daughter, and tests you with a series of scenarios. The player must build a successful resort using a variety of attractions including pools, restaurants, and sports facilities. Money and resource management are both important for success, and the player must maintain the resort by keeping it clean and well equipped.

83537.name: Ring of the Ruby Dragon
83537.description:
From the back of the book:
You are Chandelle, apprentice to your famed jeweler father, who has been kidnapped by creatures under the mystic spell of the evil red dragon. Somehow, you must try to rescue him. Perhaps the pouch of gems with unknown magical powers will help...

He is Coren, a beguiling young knight hoping to prove himself on his first quest. And then there is Sir Torbeck, the older, more experienced fighter, with reasons of his own for joining you. Each one offers to help you, but each has his own way of reacting to your special magic.

Will your fantasy adventure lead you to your first romance, or will the decisions you make carry you into realms in which there is no return? In a HEARTQUEST book, you, the reader, are challenged to PICK A PATH TO ROMANCE AND ADVENTURE.

83538.description:
Got a hankerin' to enter town with a different pack full of money, materials, and cowboys? Then welcome at Carson City - a New Beginning!

This expansion gives you exactly what the title suggests: a new way to begin the fantastic boardgame Carson City. Fine tune your own setup. Choose between more money, roads, cowboys, or revolvers…and be prepared to get some great new special powers, like the Marksman or Influential Connections.
83538.name: Carson City: A New Beginning

83539.name: Dungeons & Dragons Essentials: Monster Vault
rpghonor: 2011 ENnie for Best Monster/Adversary - Silver Winner
2011 Origins Awards Best Roleplaying Supplement or Adventure Nominee
83539.description:
From the Publisher:

Iconic Dungeons & Dragons monsters that are easy to run and fun to fight.

This essential product for Dungeon Masters collects the most iconic monsters of the Dungeons & Dragons world in one handy box and presents all-new variants, including new spins on such beloved monsters as dragons, orcs, and vampires. The monsters described herein are designed to be easy for Dungeon Masters to use and fun for players to fight. In addition to combat statistics, each monster entry comes with story information to help DMs incorporate the monsters into their adventures and campaigns.

In addition to a comprehensive collection of iconic Dungeons & Dragons monsters, this box contains die-cut tokens for the monsters that appear within, as well as a 32-page adventure that showcases several of the monsters.

Dungeon Masters can easily incorporate the adventure into their ongoing campaigns. Game components:


256-page book of monsters
32-page adventure
10 sheets of die-cut monster tokens

83541.name: Spel van het jaar 2003
83541.description:
What happened in the year 2002?

Spel van het jaar 2003 (dutch for 'game of the year') offers a full-view of the year as a quiz game; an educational question/answer game. A game in which de funniest, (most/least) important moments of the year step into the spotlight.

The game has been re-edited and expanded with the alphabetgame.

Contents;
118 alphabet/question cards
1 die

83542.name: Het grote Parkeerspel
83542.description:
Each player drives his car on the border of the board. You can start having parkingplaces on the streets of the different cities. Later you can expand there building parkings with several layers.

With more layers you get more revenue when other players park in your parking.When a parking has 3 layers it cannot have a hostile take-over.

You get points by having parkings with 3 layers (1 point each parking), points by having special strategycards (with P1 bonus of 1 point) and by completing your mission card you got at the start of the game (1,2 or 3 points).

The player with 11 (2 players), 7 ( 3 players) or with 5 (4 players) points wins the game.

83543.name: Level Titles
83543.description:
User summary

This is a single page PDF file in landscape format that lists level titles for all character classes of the AD&D3 basic rules.

83544.name: Juggle!
83544.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

HAVE A BALL WITH JUGGLE!
JUGGLE! is a heartfelt tribute to classic gaming. It’s a trip back in time to the origins of arcade games that captures the 1970s vibe but is enriched by contemporary twists like friends leaderboards and achievements.

HOW TO PLAY
Use your paddle to bat balls into the air. The more balls you juggle, the more points you score. It’s as simple as that.

FEATURES

No-nonsense rules and immediate action.
Heart-warming retro styling with a distinctly modern flavour.
Space-age audio effects take you on a trip.
Find your own groove by playing along to your favourite tunes.
Prove yourself through OpenFeint Leaderboards, Achievements and Challenges.

83545.name: Wild Magic
83545.description:
User summary

Wild magic provides rules for the wild mage, a magic-user variant that uses wild magic. Whenever a wild mage casts a spell with variables for duration, area of effect or damage based on the caster's level, the wild mage rolls on a chart to determine at what level the spell is effectively cast. This may be one or more levels higher or lower than his current level. It may also effect in a wild surge, an unpredictable casting result that is determined randomly on a d100 table.

83547.name: Inkstrumental
83547.description:
From the developer's website:

Inkstrumental™ is quite simply a global hit sensation! ‘Make and Share’ your mental music video masterpiece with your friends and the world via YouTube. ustwo™ teamed up with acclaimed artist Jon Burgerman to create what is possibly the craziest sound app ever for the iPhone.

Original animations, bizarre sound effects and the unique Burgerman aesthetic make up this highly addictive app, allowing users to create, save and share their sonic creativity.

The idea for Inkstrumental™ is pretty straightforward, with users selecting a range of various Burgerman characters, each with its own crazy and fun sound when tapped (some characters make the beats, others the synth).

The user can then decide which eight characters they want to create their own unique Inkstrumental™ masterpiece with, and once created users can share their soundtracks via YouTube to all.

83548.name: Doodle Dash!
83548.description:
User Summary

Doodle Dash is a game in which you use the iPhone's accelerometer to tilt-control a cute monster through a forest. In the forest are loads of treasure you want to collect, but also many monsters you are trying to avoid. There's also a bunch of stars, which can be both good or bad for our little monster, Dash.

83549.name: War and Peace - 1796-1815
83549.description:
Summary
Go down in history as one of the great names of the 19th century ! Take control of the strategy ans destiny of your counry : from internal policies ans economic and scientific development, right through to war and diplomacy... Lead your nation through realistic historical settings and become one of the great statesmen of the turbulent early stages of the 19th century.
Main features
- The whole world modelled in 3D !
- 183 towns to conquer.
- Armies made up of different types of unit: infantry, artillery, navy, cavalry, special units...
- 6 playables nations and over 30 neutral nations defending their interests.
- Advanced tactical planning: troop types and formation, use of terrain, logistics, naval warfare.
- Realistic historical context: territories, characters, balance of power, strategie situations...
- Play any way you want: You decides what constitutes victory !

Source: The Publisher Website.

83550.name: Adventure Maximum Core Rules (Playtest Draft)
83550.description:
User summary

This is the PDF version of the Adventure Maximum rules.

It covers:


Dice mechanics
Character creation (human characters only)
Melee and ranged combat
Vehicle combat
Weapons and equipment

83551.name: Ultima Online: The Second Age
videogamehonor: 1999 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Winner
1999 D.I.C.E. Massively Multiplayer Game of the Year Winner
83551.description:
Ultima Online: The Second Age (October 1, 1998) expands Ultima Online. It features a new area of land called the Lost Lands, along with an in-game chat system and new creatures. Also known as T2A. It was released in two boxed versions with the first having different artwork and a single manual.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ultima Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83552.name: Adventure Quest - Jaern
83552.description:
User summary

The Adventure Quest - Jaern rulebook contains the complete game rules and an overview of the campaign setting.

It contains:

Character creation and advancement rules
Character archetypes
Combat rules
Three spell-based magic systems (elemental, divine, incants)
Naval rules (vessels and steeds, building ships, naval combat, trade)
Campaign background (overview, details on Lojem Isle and the city of Karfelon)
Spell lists and background information for elemental magic
A description of the gods and their followers, including divine spells
Nomad culture and lists of nomadic incants
Rules for creating magic items
Magic items and artifacts
Sample characters
Rules for creating creatures
A bestiary of Jaern
GM advice
Sample adventure
Designer notes
Glossary and index

83553.name: Over Flanders Fields: Between Heaven and Hell
videogameexpansion: Microsoft Combat Flight Simulator 3: Battle for Europe
83553.description:
From the publisher's website:

World War I in the Air

OFF is flight simulation dedicated to the dawn of Air Combat - it will bring you face-to-face with the reality of what many young pilots felt fighting for their lives close up in their wood and canvas machines high above the trenches of Eastern France.

OFF has stunning WW1 sights and sounds, and unique dynamic WW1 air campaign engine, with each campaign mission being unique, with other flights on their own real missions. OFF will immerse you in a world long gone: the sights, sounds and memories of the skies over France and Flanders, soaring over the gentle landscapes scarred by the trenches, craters and mud of the Great War.

SOME USER COMMENTS from customers and forum users:

"I think the game is absolutely terrific. I am an ex RAF University Air Squadron pilot and have flown many old biplanes in the UK Tiger Club so I know something of how these aircraft should feel and I find the game so realistic." - Guy L.

"Best sim I have ever flown"
This aint a sweeping statement I assure you!
The sim just captures the 'feel' of flying a Stick and string biplane against other crates!
- WidowmakerUK

"This is by far the best WWI sim ever made!
I too have fond memories of climbing into the old 80's Red Baron video game and ku'chuncking a quarter into it so that I could fly against the Red Baron! ...
Incredible! - Markimus

83554.name: Nuked, not Stirred...
83554.description:
User summary

Nuked, not Stirred... is a free adventure for Agent S.E.V.E.N..

The adventure sends the characters on the hunt for an ex-general of the former USSR who threatens the USA with a nuclear strike.

83555.name: Operation Asia
83555.description:
User summary

Operation Asia is a free adventure for Agent S.E.V.E.N..

The adventure features a Chinese warlord, his albino henchman, a genetically engineered army, and a secret island.

83556.name: Alacrity
83556.description:
User summary

These are the Alacrity rules on a single HTML page. The rules cover:


Character creation
Task resolution
Combat, damage and healing
A rudimentary magic system
GM advice.

83557.name: UK Masquerade Players' Rule Book
83557.description:
From the Book's Introduction:

This Players' Rule Book is subject to yearly update. Errors or omissions found between revisions will be notified by issue of an Errata, changes to be included immediately in the working copy (and the revision number updated). This booklet is not meant to be a substitute for any of the White Wolf™ source books, and as such we recommend that players at least purchase and read the relevant clan book. Queries about the interpretation of these rules should first be directed to your Referee or Storyteller who may consult the Admin Council. The latest version of this book and other related UK Masquerade materials (including UKM contact lists, and web links to all domains) is available from the UK Masquerade web site.


User Summary:

The core player rulebook includes:

Character creation
Disciplines (covering Camarilla clans only)
General rules
Ghoul rules
Experience points

83558.name: UKM Wiki
83558.description:
User Summary:

The UKM Wiki is a wiki (built using MediaWiki software) that contains the rules for the UK Masquerade LARP in an indexed and editable format.

The content of the UK Masquerade Players' Rule Book is included here, along with additional information on some of the restricted Clans (although complete details of these Clans is still not published in order not to remove the mystery for players).

83559.name: Adventurer (Issue 6 - Jan 1986)
83559.description:
- "CHRISTMAS CHEER" by Simon Farrell & Jon Sutherland (Paranoia scenario)
- "SHOP WINDOW" RPG reviews by staff (includes review of GURPS)
- "THE TOWN CRIER" by Ian Marsh & Ste Dillon (RPG news)
- "FIGURES FRONT" by Martyn Tetlow and Mike Willis
- "MORE DEADLY THAN THE MALE: FEMALE CHARACTERS IN A FANTASY SETTING" Essay by Janet Vialls
- "THE BEASTMARKET" Scatophagium campaign scenario by Robin Parry
- "SLIME TIME" by Alex Bardy (Paranoia scenario)
- "FANZINES FOREVER" by Alex Bardy & Ben Goodale
- "ONCE BITTEN" comic strip series by Robin Parry
- "WHAT IS PLAY BY MAIL?" by Wayne Bootleg
- "LIVE BY THE SWORD" Letters to the Editor
- "VOYAGES BEYOND" by Wendy Graham (& Neil Gaiman) SF book reviews
- "FRONTIER" SF short story by Adam Oyebanji
- "ONE MAN'S MEAT" by Ann Broomfield (Essay on poison in RPGs)
- "WHIPLASH" graphic novel serial by Warren Ellis & Stewart Johnson

83560.name: Customizable Battlemaps: Dungeon Rooms Vol. II
83560.description:
From the publisher:

Did you ever dream to make yourself the gorgeous battlemaps produced by Øone? Do you want an alchemist laboratory with the objects you decide inside? Do you want to put a trap under the staircase or want the treasure room plundered? Do you want to show the same room but with things changed to the player who visit it for the second time? With this new, exciting product you can do all of these and more! Still, you will have a beautiful, superb rendered map, to throw under the feet of your player's miniatures.

With Customizable Battlemaps you can quickly modify the popular battlemaps produced by Øone. With few clicks you can modify the objects, the doors and even the lighting of the room. Want the door opened? Click, just done. Want the door shattered? Click, done. With each map you can produce and print an average 3000 different maps!

Features:
Intuitive Interface: No troubles: few clicks to modify an print your favourite map.
PDF format: run just on every computer in the world.
Control Sheet: Each map comes with a control sheet you should visualize with the map page in order to see the changes you apply in real time (see picture above)
Lighting Controls: You can change the lighting type of the room. You can use standard lighting, low lighting and spotlight.
Default Presets: these are the built-in presets. Each map has four built-in presets. these are the most common room configurations: plundered room, empty room and the like.
Custom Presets: this feature allows you to store your maps. Once you’ve assembled your map click on “save preset” to save it, and on “load preset” to recall it.
Room Title and Description: You can store custom room titles and descriptions with the maps. The title you type here will be stored in the preset you save and will be printed on one side of the map. The field description allow you to store notes about your map.
B&W Version: you can generate a black and white, ink-saving version of the map, just one click to do it.
Map Control: The B&W miniature map shows (red-highlighted zones) the areas you can click and change. Your click cycles the various configurations of each zone. For example: if you click on the door once, the door will open; if you click on the door one more time, the door will appear broken on the floor; if you click again the door will return closed. Each zone could have two or more options, click to discover them.

83561.description:
Board game which needs an Yvio console to be played. When a chip is inserted, there are seven different game options (and a combination of several of these). The board contains pictures of 20 animals. When a player puts a pawn on one of these, it is registered by the machine.
The console can make the sounds of the 20 animals, and most game ideas use this. The sound of one animal sounds, for example, and the first player to put a piece on the corresponding picture scores, for example. The console also functions as a die, so some roll and moves are also included. The "Olympiade" mode combines the scores of various games to determine an overall winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)
83561.name: Yvio: Pettersson und Findus

83562.name: The Great City Campaign Setting
83562.description:
From publisher blurb:

Based on their acclaimed Blueprints Series, 0one Games introduces an ambitious and detailed look at the locations behind the maps.

This sourcebook portrays a struggling mercantile colony ruled by the incompetent son of a brutal emperor. A city whose earliest citizens proudly trace their history back for thousands of years, but now struggle against social and political oppression; a city where a brooding underbelly of resistance fighters, and crime syndicates, and a proud but disillusioned military all wait for their lord to fail. It is a city where night cloaks the deviant works of social outcasts, mad alchemists, and corpse robbers.

The Great City is rife with excitement, intrigue and adventure; dare your characters make it their home?

This book contains the detailed description of the six wards of the Great City, including most relevant NPCs, adventure locations, encounters and more.
A big two pages-spreading gorgeous map of the city is included, with detailed key.
Within each chapter you'll find an one full-page map detailing the ward.
A short introducing adventure "The Cost of Freedom", by Tim Hitchcock is provided for a fresh start of your Great City campaign.
A chapter with unique creatures of the Great City provides you some foes to throw on your group.
A separate chapter with 3.5 statblocks for each NPC complete the book.

83563.name: EOS Rules Guide
83563.description:
From the Book's Introduction:

Welcome to the live role-playing game Eos, set in the World of Dawn. This book is the rules guide for the game. It contains all of the information that you should need to design a character and play. It also contains some basic background information on all of the races and history of the World of Dawn.

The rules contained in this book have been written with inexperienced players of live role-playing games in mind and we have tried to explain many of the concepts in as clear a way as possible. With this in mind, we ask that you use the book in the best way that you can to get a feel for how to play the game. Some players may only need to read a small amount of some of the sections included, whereas others may find it useful to read every page; that choice, of course, is yours.

As designer of the rules and game world, it is my hope that you, as a player, will be able to share in the imaginative ideas I have attempted to communicate here and take them a great deal further than I am capable of doing. All of the rules material contained in this guide is considered to be open source, and as such eminently usable by other people to make and design their own live role-playing games, indeed, I actively encourage this as others actively encouraged me. The game world information I consider to belong to the players of the game. With this in mind, we politely request that should you be looking to design your own world and see these ideas as a source of inspiration please do contact me and ask for permission. By making the effort, you will probably get what you are after.

A great deal of thanks must go to several people in the writing of this book. To all of the people involved in the writing of the Lorien Trust player's guide version 2, especially Andy King. To Matt Davey for his work on the Twilight Gothic Rules and to Matt Pennington for his generous attitude with his own rules for Maelstrom. The rules of Eos draw from my contributions and experience of these three sources. Other thanks must go to the contributions made by several users of the Pagga.com live role playing forum, Ed Fortune for his kind donation of the Eos Forum and all the assistance granted therein.

Finally some additional thanks should go to all of the players of Eos over the last three years. Your enthusiasm, criticism, feedback and praise has kept us working late into the nights to make our game better.

83564.name: The Great City Map Folio
83564.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, you will see the Great City as you never seen before!

What you will find in this product:

The Great City Poster Map
An amazing 25,5 x11 inches poster showing the whole Great City in three dimensions! You can recognize each landmark of the city at a glance: the Circus Maximus, Castle Atregan, The Temple of the Silver Lady and so on. The Rule the Dungeon© feature allows you to hide and show the poster features and print it as you like (text, north mark)
The poster map comes as a whole (allowing you to bring it to a print server to make a gorgeous poster) and broken in three us letter sheets, for home printing.

The Great City Map
This is a full color, 25,5 x 22 inches gorgeous map of the Great City. The Rule the Dungeon© feature allows you to hide and show the map features and print it as you like.

Available features are:

Text: hide/show names and numbers
Grid: hide/show a large 8oft square grid
Cross-reference text: hide/show text useful for cross-referencing grid squares
Trim Lines: hide/show ward boundary lines
North and Scale: hide/show north mark and scale
Key on Map: hide/show on-map key boxes




The map comes as a whole (allowing you to bring it to a print server to make a gorgeous poster) and broken in six us letter sheets, for home printing.

83565.name: Multi Score
83565.description:
Move as in "Chinese Checkers" (e.g. pieces jump over other pieces) trying to score as many points as possible by occupying your opponent's most important positions with your most valuable counters. The object of the game is to attempt to do this while avoiding your opponent's efforts to occupy YOUR most valuable bases. At the same time, you must try to box-in his/hers most important counters. To find your score, you must multiply the figure on the counter with the figure on the square. Simple rules.

(Description from the back of the box.)

83566.name: EOS Character Generation: Quick Guide
83566.description:
From the Quick Guide:

This character generation quick guide has been produced for your convenience. It is not a replacement for the rule book. For more information on what each of the below spells and abilities do, please refer to the EOS rulebook.

83567.name: Claws at Eos Events
83567.description:
User Summary:

A one-page document that gives guidelines on how claws should be constructed and used in order to be safe at Eos events.

83568.name: Shields at Eos Events
83568.description:
User Summary:

A one-page document that gives guidelines on how shields should be constructed and used in order to be safe at Eos events.

83569.name: Steamworks
83569.description:
From opening paragraphs:

This book deals with technology and how it interacts with magic and psionics. The technology herein uses the real world as a rough guideline regarding what technology can and cannot do, with some leeway granted by the idea that in a world of magic, the rules of nature can be bent and sometimes broken. Some of the devices may seem unrealistic, but abilities such as cloaking and temporal manipulation make technology roughly on par with magic. However, some things, such as the wish spell, are not replicated by technology, and are just too fantastic. This book was written to be a viable alternative to magic, but not to replace it.
There are no assumptions made about the settings this technology is used in. The information is presented to make it feel technological (by using charges and physical devices) and still retain balance within the d20 system. While the relationship between technology and magic (and psionics) is discussed, neither magic nor psionics is required to use these devices. These rules could just as easily represent real-world technology at the end of the 19th century (with the exception of those items that bend the rules, such as cloaking and temporal manipulation devices), as it could describe technology that springs up in a typical fantasy setting.

83570.name: Deck of  Many Woes and Wonders
83570.description:
From publisher blurb:

No other item can bring both hope and fear at such levels as this deck. Some fear it, some love it but all must respect it ability to forever alter their life and the lives of their companions. Many a night has been spent simply drawing from the deck rather than attempting to complete a mighty quest. Many a characters have lost themselves to the deck. Many a terrors have been unleashed unto the world from the deck. And yet, many a wonders have been found thanks to the deck.

This supplement is about the Deck of Many Things, variant decks and variant rules to use with them.

Includes:

Rules
Variant Decks
100 card effects
SRD Deck of Many Things
Seperate file with cards designed to be printed on preperforated business card paper.

83571.name: Arcane Class: Hermetic Mage
83571.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hermetic Magic can be labeled (and in many circles it is) as one of the most complicated systems of spiritual attainment. Hermetic Magic has sometimes been termed "Ceremonial Magic" because Hermeticists tend to use complex Ritual and symbolism.

Hermetics are Seekers; Seekers of Divine Truth, of Wisdom, of Understanding, of Gnosis. This curiosity may be partially satisfied through books. As a literate and literary tradition, Hermeticism holds that as seekers we can benefit through the recorded experiences and insights of others; as well as through the mediation of a living teacher and/or a group of fellow seekers.

This supplement for D20 Modern describes Hermetic (or Ceremonial) Mages. Most members of secret societies such as the Golden Dawn, the OTO and such would be classified as Hermetic Mages. It provides a wealth of information, not only in crunchy stats, but there are 6 pages alone detailing what it means to be Hermetic.

Arcane Class - Hermetic Mage can also be used with Magic: The Science and Art of Causing Change (another D20 Modern supplement from 93 Games Studio).

83572.name: Encounter at Archway
83572.description:
From the Guide's Introduction:

Welcome to the Eos Event Guide for our first event - Encounter at Archway. Here you will find all the necessary information in relation to the site and everything else specific to the weekend.

Included in your booking pack should be the following items:

DVD/CD
Rules Guide
Creature Guide
Event Guide
Lore Sheets(s)
Ticket




If any of these items are missing then please contact us immediately and we will do our best to rectify the situation.

Encounter at Archway is a new adventure for all of us, as this will be the first game of the new Eos live role-playing system. I started writing Eos more than two years ago and it has undergone a lot of editing and revision in both the rules guide that you may already have seen, the creature guides and the other campaign documents we have written to add depth to the game. To me, that's the acid test of any live role-playing system; when you scratch at the surface, you hope to find hidden layers to the game.

Our aim is to offer you an entertaining role-playing experience that makes you want to come back for more. Eos is the game I have always wanted to run and that I have huge of enthusiasm for working on, I hope you enjoy it.

Lastly, I have to offer some thanks to all the people who have helped me put this game together. From early rules ideas to surviving the mid summer heat on the hilltop when filming "The Broken Sword" to the proof reading and cajoling me to keep working on the rules and campaign.

Particular thanks have to go to Stuart, Lisa and my partner Karen, who've put up with my hermit like existence chained to this computer.

83573.name: Gangs of Freeport
83573.description:
From publisher blurb:

For a time, the thieves of Freeport were a scourge the likes of which the worst pirates could only envy. They were dangerous. They were organized. They were smart. For years, a powerful thieves guild thrived in the city of adventure, growing ever richer as the honest citizens --- well, honester citizens --- suffered.

It was a century gone by that the Sea Lord Marquetta engaged the guild in the so-called Back Alley War, breaking their back and scattering them to the four winds... or the gibbet. The gangs that plague Freeport today are a pale shadow of the guild that was.

Men and women of great vision and limited morality have often attempted to rebuild the guild, to unite the gangs into a new great power. All have failed. Any attempt to forge the gangs into a force to match the guild of old is doomed to failure.

That's the funny thing about Freeport, though. The city's come a long way, and "doomed" just isn't what it used to be.

In Gangs of Freeport, the PCs find themselves swept up in events as a mysterious power, making use of techniques both mystical and malign, shows signs of succeeding where others failed. The various gangs of the city work together, and the Sea Lord's Guard proves helpless to stem the rising tide of crime. Only through keen observation, determined investigation, and the judicious use of bloody violence can the characters uncover an old evil behind the threat, and take steps to put it down.

Gangs of Freeport is an adventure for four characters of 5th to 7th level.

83574.name: Into the Wild
83574.description:
From the Guide's Introduction:

Welcome to the Eos Event Guide for our second event - Into the Wild. Here you will find all find all the necessary information in relation to the site and anything else specific to the weekend.

Included in your return pack should be the following items:

Creature Guide (new characters only)
Event Guide
Ticket




If any of these items are missing then please contact us immediately and we do our best to rectify the situation. If you are a new player and need any additional material, please just let us know. Most things are available from the website but we are more than happy go through any questions you might have.

We've spent the winter looking at how the first event went and taken on board all of the feedback we received. As a result, you should see some improvements and less sleepless nights for our staff!

We have made some amendments to our rules guide. You will find a list of the changes from version 1.02 to version 1.1. on our website. In addition, if you attended the first event, you should have received your first event downtime results.

If you have been to a Hicks with Sticks event before then you will know all about the evening meal and licensed bar. The serving and opening times are in this guide and please remember your Saturday night meal is included in your ticket price.

Our continuing aim is to offer you an entertaining live role-playing experience that makes you want to come back for more. To this end, we are open to new ideas and the re-examination of some of the accepted conventions of live role-playing. For us this is a continual learning experience, so please do feel you can talk to us about any aspect of the game.

Thank you for your support and trust in us, hopefully we can provide you with a great event.

83575.name: Bamf GM Screen
83575.description:
User summary

The Bamf GM Screen is a 3-page PDF file with the following tables:


TAL Number Line
TAL Fatigue
TAL Recovery
Plus Points
Concentration Checks
Hit Points and Personal Soak
Self Rating or Roll to Ability Score
Number of Rolls by Ability Score
Attacking
Firing in a Target
Evasion and Precision
Stances
Calculating Overall Speed
Armor, weapon and skill modifiers
Task Modifiers
Unconsciousness Duration
Healing Damage

83576.name: Posthuman
83576.description:
From publisher blurb:

FPosthuman: The Definitive D20 Guide to Human Augmentation is a 29-page resource that expands the options for technologically enhanced characters. The new rules here are designed to be compatible with the standard rules for futuristic D20 roleplaying, and you should have no trouble adding them to your game.

Here's what you get:

The Posthuman Template Class: Instead of using a fixed template that adjusts a character's effective level, we present the concept of a template class: a five level option that allows you to choose how powerful you want posthumans to be and whether or not you want to abide by the standard drawbacks for augmented humans. If you don't like the idea of penalizing characters for their enhancements but you don't want to trash game balance, this is the section for you.
Biotech: Next, we'll look at biotechnology and how it can replace or augment characters' natural abilities. You can use these rules with characters from standard classes. Like cybernetics, biotech comes with its own complications, keeping biologically engineered characters from running roughshod over play balance. To transcend these drawbacks, just plug in the Posthuman class.
Nanotech: Nanotechnology seems to have an unlimited potential to augment human ability. The rules in this section present a modest array of nanotech enhancements that, like biotech, come with drawbacks to balance out their benefits. Again, you can plug in the Posthuman class to mitigate or remove these restrictions.
Posthuman Characters: Finally, we present three enhanced characters as a proof of concept and to give you ready made enemies, allies and player characters.




Posthuman: The Definitive D20 Guide to Human Augmentation is written by Malcom Sheppard (author of several supplements for White Wolf's Mage: The Ascension, among other products) and is the premiere release in Adamant Entertainment's TERMINAL IDENTITY line of Cyberpunk-genre products.

83577.name: Pathogis
83577.description:
From the Guide's Introduction:

Welcome to the Eos Event Guide for our Fifth event - Pathogis. Here you will find all the necessary information in relation to the site and anything else specific to the weekend.

Included in your return pack should be the following items:

Event Guide
Ticket




Should you require an updated creature guide, please email us. If either of these items is missing then please contact us immediately and we will do our best to rectify the situation. If you are a new player and need any additional material, please just let us know. Most things are available from the website but we are more than happy go through any questions you might have.

Pathogis is the second event of 2009 for Hicks with Sticks and we have another event planned this year. Since the last year we’ve revised the creature guides, so if you have not seen the new guide, please contact us. If you have any questions before the event just email and ask.

Over the winter the team will sit down and go through everything with a view to what we will for 2010. If you have any thoughts on this, please do let us know. For us this is a continual learning experience, so please do feel you can talk to us about any aspect of the game.

If you have been to a Hicks with Sticks event before then you will know that the Saturday night meal is included in your ticket and that we have a licensed bar. The serving and opening times are in this guide.

Thank you for your continued support and trust in us, hopefully you are enjoying our events and we can provide you with another great live role-playing experience.

83578.name: Return to Gladebrook
83578.description:
From the Guide's Introduction:

Welcome to the Eos Event Guide for our sixth event - Return to Gladebrook. Here you will find all find all the necessary information in relation to the site and anything else specific to the weekend.

Included in your return pack should be the following items:

Event Guide
Ticket




Should you require an updated creature guide, please email us. If either of these items is missing then please contact us immediately and we will do our best to rectify the situation. If you are a new player and need any additional material, please just let us know. Most things are available from the website but we are more than happy go through any questions you might have.

Gladebrook is the third and final event of 2009 for Hicks with Sticks. Since the last year we've revised the creature guides, so if you have not seen the new guide, please contact us. If you have any questions before the event just email and ask.

Over the winter the team will sit down and go through everything with a view to what we will for 2010. If you have any thoughts on this, please do let us know. For us this is a continual learning experience, so please do feel you can talk to us about any aspect of the game.

If you have been to a Hicks with Sticks event before then you will know that the Saturday night meal is included in your ticket and that we have a licensed bar. The serving and opening times are in this guide.

Thank you for your continued support and trust in us, hopefully you are enjoying our events and we can provide you with another great live role-playing xperience.

83579.name: Rest No More...
83579.description:
From the Guide's Introduction:

Welcome to the Eos Event Guide - Rest No More. Here you will find all the necessary information in relation to the site and anything else specific to the weekend.

Included in your return pack should be the following items:

Event Guide
Ticket




Should you require an updated creature guide, please email us. If either of these items is missing then please contact us immediately and we will do our best to rectify the situation. If you are a new player and need any additional material, please just let us know. Most things are available from the website but we are more than happy go through any questions you might have.

Rest No More is the first event of 2010 for Hicks with Sticks. If you have any questions before the event just email and ask.

If you have been to a Hicks with Sticks event before then you will know that the Saturday night meal is included in your ticket and that we have a licensed bar. The serving and opening times are in this guide.

Any profits taken from the bar and food go back into the game and help us to keep the overall price of the ticket down.

Thank you for your continued support and trust in us, hopefully you are enjoying our events and we can provide you with another great live role-playing experience.

83580.name: Shock & Awe
83580.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you want characters to react to the emotional impact of battle? Do you want them to run when it would be a good idea for them to run, for a change? If so, welcome to Shock & Awe! This set of rules is about morale.

We've rebuilt morale from the ground up, adhering to the OGL system's logic to make a rules set that's easy to work with. Morale becomes a point system; stress depletes it and anything from flight to stirring speeches renews it. We call this ablative morale.

With this in force, characters need more than a weapon and a steady hand. They need the will to fight - and win.

Here's what you get:
