What Is Ablative Morale? We answer this with rules for morale hit dice, attacks and damage.
Morale Damage Types and Special Effects. Dread, terror, creature and energy types ? not all morale damage means the same thing. This includes guidelines for morale-affecting spells and FX.
New Feats and Optional Rules. This section includes new feats, talent tress and rules for propaganda campaigns and insanity. These guidelines let you connect the system to character creation and customize it for horror genre games. Unify combat morale with supernatural terror in one system!

83581.name: TACTICAL IMPLANT
83581.description:
From publisher blurb:

TACTICAL IMPLANT: The Definitive D20 Guide to Cyberpunk Combat Options is a 27-page resource that details a set of options you can use to customize Modern SRD and Future SRD campaigns. All of these optional rules are about one thing: Combat!

Here's what you get:

Variant Fighting Classes:Using the examples of the Soldier and Bodyguard, we demonstrate how to tweak standard Advanced Classes to serve a cyberpunk-genre campaign
Nonlethal Damage: Standard rules for nonlethal damage don't always match the genre's penchant for martial arts action and noirish knockouts. We present a simple revamp of the Modern SRD's rules for nonlethal damage that finally allows low level, unskilled combatants a chance to take each other out.
Scenario Training: Train your character the way professionals do:for the mission. Use scenario training to prepare for your specific encounters.
Ablative Morale: For a grittier edge, use ablative morale to measure how much violence your character can take before he psychologically shuts down or flees -- or until another character talks him back from the edge of despair. Two new talent trees give Charismatic and Dedicated heroes an edge under this system. New Feats toughen your character's mind, let him inspire an entire squad, or even design a meme to influence millions.
Cyborgs in Combat: Metal and flesh collide in new rules that discuss how cybernetics influence grappling, defense, speed and power. Two new talent trees give Strong and Fast cyborgs the ability to hit harder with artificial hands or evade gunfire with enhanced reflexes.
Weapon Mods & Gadgets: New gadgets and after-market alterations let you customize your weapons and ammo. Carry nanite payloads, give a blade a fractal edge, or make the whole sword out of wickedly sharp, retractable wire.
Combat Frames: If you'd rather be stronger without losing an arm and a leg, use a combat frame's exoskeleton to enhance a single limb, or piece them together into a suit of powered armor. Improve your purchase with gadgets like extra armor and defensive nanotechnology.
Combat Nanotechnology: New invisible threats enter the field. Use gray goo, tracers and binders to attack enemies, or employ defensive nanites to keep these microscopic machines at bay. See how nanites move and threaten the battle map and how characters hack nanotech design to create their own nanotech weapons.

83582.name: The Milk Run
83582.description:
From publisher blurb:

“The Milk Run” is a short, single session D&D adventure designed for a party of three to six characters of levels 1-2 (about six total levels). A good mix of characters is important, and a Ranger would be helpful, but not necessary, and a Wizard or Sorcerer is almost essential. The party’s alignment should tend towards good to preserve the intent of the adventure.
This adventure takes place along and near a trade road that travels through a humanoid infested forest and may easily be adapted into most campaign settings with only cosmetic changes. The set-up of the story easily allows for this adventure to be a group’s first adventure together.
The scenario is combat heavy and is designed to pull a group of inexperienced heroes together in a trial by fire. The adventure requires a bit of finesse on the part of the characters, and imprudence may result in failure to defeat a group of kidnappers and, in the worst case, may lead to the murder of innocent hostages.

83583.name: Covenent Hill
83583.description:
From publisher blurb:

Covenent Hill is an adventure designed for characters of levels 5-7. Players must enter a ruined garrison that is infested with undead, fight to discover the true source of the evil emanating from Covenent Hill - and destroy it. But at the end, the players will make a difficult decision between justice...and greed.

83584.name: 50 Fathoms Player's Guide
83584.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first 51 pages of the 50 Fathoms setting book for Savage Worlds, a 144-page hardback from Great White Games and Pinnacle Entertainment Group. Here's what 50 Fathoms is all about: The natives say a trio of witches were discovered working dark sorcery in the land of Ograpog. The three were tried, sentenced by King Amemnus himself, and drowned with the rising tide. But with their dying breath the sisters uttered a dark curse, drowning Caribdus beneath 50 Fathoms of water. Soon after, ships from another world drifted through the mists of earth and into the “Thousand Isles.” The visitors are sailors from the age of piracy, dashing corsairs, bloodthirsty buccaneers, or savage sea dogs. They’ve taken to this new world and now sail alongside its strange inhabitants—crab-like scurillians, massive grael, lonely doreen, mysterious kraken, cruel kehana, and the near-human masaquani. Many believe these visitors are destined to defeat the Sea Hags and save Caribdus, but most just seem interested in plundering her for the forgotten treasures of a drowned world. 50 Fathoms is Plot Point setting for the Savage Worlds roleplaying and miniatures game.

83585.name: The Temple of Andar
83585.description:
From the front cover:

Pirates have been raiding local shipping, but not just ant pirates. These are different, cunning and dangerous, and definitely not human! Only a handful of survivors have lived to tell the tale of these attacks - a tale filled with horror.
After being contracted to investigate and put a stop to the acts of piracy, you discover the Temple. You soon realize this is much more than you can handle by yourself - but by then it is too late!

A Fantasy Role-Playing Adventure for Character Levels 5-7.

83586.name: Alchemist Subclass
83586.description:
From opening paragraphs:

Subclasses present a new way of augmenting your character into a specific role beyond that of a normal character class or by obtaining prestige class levels.

Alchemists are innovators who explore the boundaries that hold basic chemicals together. They search for understanding that lead to manipulation of the very elements they explore. Whereas most of their colleagues and peers rely on only the arcane to fuel their knowledge, alchemists are the first scientists to understand the why and how of arcana and the natural world.

83587.name: Signum Mortis
83587.description:
Signum Mortis is a game for 3 to 6 players lasting between 3 to 5 hours aimed at more mature gamers. The game - even though cynical and satirical - is based in part on the historical facts as outlines by Marcus Tullius Cicero in his famous speech in defense of Sextus Roscius. Even though you can trust Cicero - as lawyer that he was - to illuminate the 'facts' in a specific light, also according to other sources the proscriptions were every bit as bad and corrupt as shown in this game.

Players take the role of Chiefs of Roman gangs from the Aventine Hill during Sulla’s reign of terror and proscription of 82BC. On one hand the players are building a reputation for being most daring, bringing proscribed but highly influential Senators or Equites to 'justice' (by chopping of their heads). By this they gain blood money as bounty while also plundering the homes of those unfortunates. Still, some of that money should better find its way back into Crysogonus’ coffers. The freedman Chrysogonus was Sulla's right-hand man in this and his 'secretarius' meticulously notes down your name and the bounty paid. Chrysogonus does not look favorable on those lacking generosity in their presents. On the other hand, the gangs also raise money by extorting the grain merchants or the red-light district. Player’s might also prey on each other in an attempt to rob the other gangs of their ill-gotten wealth either on the way home or by besieging or storming and plundering their lair. But beware Sulla’s veterans patrolling the streets and your competitors as bounty hunter, Sulla’s freedmen the Sullani. Players use their boss and his three lieutenants, all of them being specialized for different roles, and beef up their gangs by rogues lending numbers, muscles, speed or stealth. Sometimes guile succeeds where brutal force fails. The hulking brute - worth 3 normal men in a fight - might be hard-pressed to blend into the crowd if a patrol of Veterans enters the city quarter. Players might try to bribe officials to influence the Civil War, steer the patrols or 'ameliorate'their records with the 'secretarius' while influencing the proscription lists. They use prophecies by the witch (the 'Stryga') to influence and scare their superstitious opponents. The overall goal is to become the richest and most infamous of all bosses. Still, finally peace will come. Depending on the outcome of the civil war which the players might vigorously try to influence, the Chief having killed the wrong people and the Chief not having parted generously enough with his money, "unfortunately" will be executed.

This will leave only those of the rich and infamous who survived, to finally win the game.

83588.name: Crusader Subclass
83588.description:
From opening paragraphs:

Subclasses present a new way of augmenting your character into a specific role beyond that of a normal character class or by obtaining prestige class levels.

One who travels to distant lands to fight for their deity against infidels in contested territories is a crusader. Most journey toward designated holy lands to fulfill religious duty or perhaps as penitence for sins. Many may receive a calling from their deity from priests or from a direct vision. Despite their personal reasons, a knight takes up arms against those in the holy lands. Most crusaders are often spurred towards such ends by charismatic church leaders.
Rewards for success could earn a crusader reputation, redemption, and possibly a tidy profit. However, most crusaders look toward eternal reward with their patron god or goddess. These faithful warriors take great care in dispensing the full fury of their faith upon those considered infidels and heretics.

83589.name: Earl Grey and This Rupert Guy
83589.description:
There’s a package that must be delivered, and Rupert the Deliveryman delivers any package directly to its owner. But the mansion of Earl Grey is not a usual mansion: it has mysteries, puzzles, and ghosts. Best of all, it has a pair of glasses which allows Rupert to see supernatural things!
Rupert will do anything to deliver his package directly to Earl Grey, but what will he do to find the Earl? How does he solve his puzzles? It’s up to you to guide this Rupert guy to finish his task!
Earl Grey and This Rupert Guy is a classic point-and-click adventure.

Source: Kongregate.

83590.name: Marksman Subclass
83590.description:
From opening paragraphs:

Subclasses present a new way of augmenting your character into a specific role beyond that of a normal character class or by obtaining prestige class levels.

Everyone has a natural gift. For some people it's a pleasant singing voice or a good memory, but for the marksman it's a talent with non-thrown ranged weapons. She can catch a fly on the wing with a slung stone, or shoot an apple off your head and land it in the mouth of a roast pig halfway across the room.
Some marksmen hone this natural talent to a high degree; gaining a level of skill that makes even the most legendary elven archer green with envy.

83591.name: D20 Future Mutations
83591.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product uses the text in the SRD to produce an affordable, stand-alone product that is easy to use without the hassle of bulky, expensive books.

This product is attractive and has numerous features that the SRD does not have. The first and foremost feature is the hyperlinked Table of Contents (go on . . . click one of the page numbers). Secondly, each of the sections, including all of the
mutations are bookmarked for easy and quick use during a game session.
Lastly, this also includes a free future map tile to get you started. This map tile is a preview of what you can do with APG Paper Tiles Vol. III: Future Basic Room Set.

So, we hope you enjoy this product and go mutate!

83592.name: HλLF-LIFE Platinum Collection
83592.description:
From the Back of Box

The Half-Life Platinum Collection contains five award-winning titles in total, making it the ultimate in both single-player and multiplayer action gaming.

Half-Life Platinum Includes:
HλLF-LIFE
HλLF-LIFE: Opposing Force
Team Fortress Classic
HλLF-LIFE: Counter-Strike
HλLF-LIFE: Blue Shift

83593.name: Quests
83593.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Game Enhancement for Honor and Corruption

Quests are monumental undertakings by those of honorable character. Once fulfilled, they provide a testimony to the character and their accomplishments bestowing recognizable abilities.
With the Quest feat described later, a character can set out to accomplish a specific quest that they previously chosen. Once the quest is fulfilled, the character will be granted permanent special abilities and honor points to be applied to their honor score at the end of the game session.
However, not just those with the Quest feat may try to accomplish a questing task, anyone willing to attempt a quest may do so. These characters will be able to also earn honor points, but will not be able to possess the abilities granted to those with the Quest feat.
Thirdly, you can also use the following quests for a guideline when a character is under the effect of a lesser geas, geas, or quest spells.

83594.name: Sandhold
83594.description:
From the front cover:

Shipwrecked! Stranded on an island you've only heard whispered legends of, you must use all of your resources to stay alive and find a way home. The key to your rescue must lie in the castle made of sand and inhabited by a fiendish creature who doesn't want you to escape!

A Fantasy Role-Playing Module for Character Levels 1-3

User note:

The module lacks artwork and maps that were to be produced by the co-author John C. Benson Jr. who passed away before it was complete, therefore the module was never published.

83595.name: Insanity
83595.description:
From publisher blurb:

This system allows you to introduce an element of dark horror into your game. In campaigns using these rules, characters gain a new attribute called Sanity.
This statistic functions like an ability score in some ways, but it has its own unique mechanics that represent the character’s descent from a stable and healthy mental state into confusion, dementia, and mental instability. As a character encounters monsters, witnesses horrible acts, masters forbidden knowledge, or cast spells, his Sanity score, and his corresponding ability to function as a normal member of his race, deteriorates. This gradual descent is balanced in part by the powers that characters gain each time they overcome a horrific foe or grow in skill and expertise, but even as those characters grow in power, they know or fear that an even greater peril lays ahead —
the threat of becoming permanently insane.

83596.name: Legacy
83596.description:
From publisher blurb:

This campaign enhancement provides the beginning tools needed to make your campaign a Legacy Enhanced setting. You may be able to use everything in this campaign enhancement, or you may elect to use only a select few of the elements this product provides. After all, it is your campaign world, so the option is up to you.

83597.name: Professions
83597.description:
From publisher blurb:

Professions allow additional background development concerning what trade, craft, livelihood, or professional role, a character played before setting off for high adventure. Professions are a direct result of a character being apprenticed for a period of time to learn a trade or livelihood. Techniques and skills a character learned while an apprentice are carried with them throughout their adventuring career.

83598.name: Weapon Focus: Improvised Modern Weapons
83598.description:
From publisher blurb:

Weapon Focus: Improvised Modern Weapons provides a list of over sixty everyday items that can be used as weapons found in homes, offices, resaurants airports and other public places.

This is the ideal supplement for any game where fighting will break out in unexpected places, or in places where the combatants will be denied their normal weapons, due to high security or any other circumstances.

Inside you'll find:


Complete stats for over 60 everyday items that can be used as weapons, including:


Purses
Briefcases
Flashlights
Cookware
Fire extinguishers
Telephones

Descriptions of each item, including mention of any alternate uses or special properties.
Rules for the use of improvised weapons.

83599.name: Weapon Focus: High-Tech Riot Control
83599.description:
From publisher blurb:

Weapon Focus: High Tech Riot Control provides alternate statistics and rules for the use of weapons designed to non-lethally subdue opponents.

Stats are included for Netguns, ADS Rifles and Grenades, Dazzlers, Non-lethal Sting Grenades and Flashbang Grenades, solidifying Foam and Sonic Weaponry.

A brief history of Netguns, ADS Rifles and Grenades, Dazzlers, Non-lethal Sting Grenades and Flashbang Grenades, solidifying Foam and Sonic Weaponry.

83600.name: Weapon Focus: Battle Axes
83600.description:
From publisher blurb:

Axe Assault - A NEW feat which allows you to sacrifice accuracy for increased damage when wielding an axe.
Axe Focus - A NEW feat which allows you to deal extra damage when wielding an axe. This feat is also a pre-requisite for Axe Assault.
Axe Fury - A NEW feat which allows you to focus on hitting your target at the expense of your ability to dodge incoming attacks.
Axe Offensive Defense - A NEW feat allowing an axe wielder to return incoming attacks with the slash of an axe.
Power Axe - A NEW feat allowing an axe wielder to increase the chances of scoring a critical hit at the expense of general accuracy.
Wield As One - A NEW feat which allows two axes to be used together as a single attack.
Spectral Axe - A NEW magical weapon which sends spectral axes flying at enemies.
Brightblade - Brightblade is a NEW legacy weapon, an axe forged to be used against the forces of chaos and infused with the souls of those warriors who fell while wielding the axe in battle. Also included is the history of Brightblade and three legacy feats granting access to the weapons unique abilities.
Battle Axe History - A brief history of the battle axe is included, from both a real life and a game perspective.

83601.name: Runic Weapons
83601.description:
From publisher blurb:

Runic Weapons is a short D20 fantasy supplement that provides an alternative way to produce magical items from that given in Dungeons & Dragons 3rd Edition. With this system, you a +1 weapon need not be BOTH +1 to hit and +1 to damage, but could instead be just +1 to hit or just +1 to damage. It also provides a groundwork for creating upgradable magical weapons and armor, much like some of your favorite CRPGs allow. The system also allows for the creation of quick and dirty one-shot magic weapons and items, as well as treasured herilooms that took generations to carve, adding another depth to the value of magic in your game. Along with the system, this booklet also details roughly 150 magic runes to get you started.

83602.name: Diamond Gulch
83602.description:
From opening paragraphs:

A d20 adventure for 4-6 characters of 5th-6th level

This adventure is appropriate for a campaign in which steamtech has been recently introduced, or in which steamtech is prevalent, but has yet to spread to outlying areas.
A character with the tracking ability will make the adventure flow more smoothly. Because one of the main tasks in the adventure is to round up frightened animals, a ranger or druid is advisable. Additionally, both combat expertise and social interaction skills are necessary to overcome all of the obstacles in the adventure.
Because such a wide range of skills are necessary, a number of NPCs are available throughout the adventure to fill in areas in
which the PCs may be lacking.

83603.name: Thieves' Guild Hideout
83603.description:
From opening paragraphs:

The guild hideout is divided into three sections: outer tunnels, which serve as the first line of defense against intruders; the living and working quarters for the thieves; and the inner sanctum, which only the elite members of the guild are allowed to access.

As the party moves through the dungeon, they will inevitably run into members of the guild. Depending on where they are at the time of the encounter, other members are likely to react to their presence.

While the party is in the outer tunnels, the thieves are content to allow the traps and hazards of the area to do their job. Once the party breaches the defenses and enters the living quarters, any thieves in the section will come to the aid of their guild mates.

83604.description:
1861 - Hoke’s Run (American Civil War in 3D)

This absolutely FREE complementary battle in our series of the American Civil Wargames in 3D sees the Union army under General M.G Robert Patterson attempting to defeat the Confederate army of General Joseph E. Johnston at Hoke’s Run in the Shenandoah Valley.

This fictional encounter is a prelude to First Manassas. The battle at Hoke’s Run could have very easily taken place, because General Patterson drove the Confederates away South from Falling Waters the previous day. The Confederates regrouped around Hoke’s Run and camped ready for battle the following day, but Patterson failed to press the Confederates and moved to Martinsburg instead. The Confederates waited four days for a battle that never came.

The game can be played in about 1 hour; it is very tactical and can be played again and again. It has a time limit of 16 bounds in which the Confederates must inflict a devastating defeat on the Union army. Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game that gives a flavour of the American Civil War period. A simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit. You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion. The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in two quadrants, the Hoke’s Run five page Battle Report, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice. The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you start this great series of battles with a victory? Play North or South in this the introductory game of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.

>Source: WargamesDownload.com
83604.name: 1861: Hoke's Run

83605.name: Abandoned Temple
83605.description:
From opening paragraphs:

The abandoned temple described herein was once dedicated to the god of the sun, and its purpose was to house a holy relic. A GM can run the temple with very minor modifications if he wishes it to be dedicated to a different god.

When the temple was abandoned, the priests secreted the relic in the bowels of the structure, and then summoned several creatures to guard it. Why the temple was abandoned is intentionally left up to the GM.

Most of the current residents of the abandoned temple are monstrous creatures who have claimed sections of the structure as their personal lairs. They are content to ignore most commotions, and will ignore the PCs until they set foot in their Encounter Area.

83606.name: The Hungry Demiplane
83606.description:
From opening paragraphs:

The hungry demiplane is an intelligent, living entity that feeds on the pain and suffering of those trapped within. As it feeds, it grows by stealing rooms and other structures from the material plane.

The description of the demiplane herein is not dependant on it having been created in any particular fashion. Therefore, you can tailor the plane's origin to suit your campaign. The following is a list of possibilities:

The plane was willed into existence by a demonic power or an evil god.
The plane splintered off from one of the evil or chaotic outer planes, and has taken on a life of its own.
The plane was created through the foul magic of a powerful mage or priest (who might still inhabit it).
The plane spontaneously generated in the Ethereal.




Regardless of its origins, the plane possesses the power to absorb portions of the material plane. Its first act was to absorb a bugbear lair, whose inhabitants it convinced to become its servants. These bugbears serve the plane by kidnapping people from the material world and bringing them back to the demiplane to torture. In exchange, the unique magic of the plane provides the bugbears a secure stronghold from which to launch raids into the material world.

83607.name: The Necromancer's Lair
83607.description:
From opening paragraphs:

This lair was once the temple dedicated to a god of agriculture and community. It had a small but loyal congregation and was situated far from large urban centers. Due to this isolation, the necromancer has been able to work his dark arts in relative security and without much interruption. A GM may run this lair with little modification if he wishes it to be dedicated to another god.

The high priest of this temple still resides within, trapped as a malevolent, twisted undead creature. The necromancer who has made this his lair was able to corrupt some of the acolytes and laity into his service and they too still reside on the grounds.

The temple site, its basement level, and the caverns beneath are practically empty of life, except for a few vermin and molds, and instead have been replaced with all manner of undead atrocities and constructs.

83608.name: Tag Team Wrestling
83608.description:
Tag Team Wrestling is a 1983 arcade video game developed by Technos Japan and released in the U.S. by Data East. In 1986, the game was ported to the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). The Famicom/NES version was developed by Sas Sakata, a company which also developed the NES versions of Karnov and BurgerTime.

In the NES version, two professional wrestling tag-teams, the Strong Bads and the Ricky Fighters, battle against each other in tag-team action, or a single player competes in a series of tournaments to win ever larger trophies. The Strong Bads provided the basis for the character Strong Bad on the popular Homestar Runner website, which abounds with obscure 1980s popular culture references.

As an 8-bit game, Tag Team Wrestling has a limited number of wrestling moves and characters. Moves and counters are performed through the use of a real-time, menu-based action-reaction fighting module. After engaging in a grapple, players quickly scroll through a menu and choose a technique to perform. Each of the four characters has a unique move that can only be used against one other "rival" wrestler.

The name of the game in Japan is The Big Pro Wrestling! for the original arcade version and Tag Team Pro Wrestling for the Family Computer version. In North America, it is Tag Team Wrestling for both the arcade and NES versions. The game was also ported to the Commodore 64 and IBM PC computers before it even made it to the Famicom, in 1984.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tag Team Wrestling," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83609.name: Eye of the Storm
83609.description:
From opening paragraphs:

The storm detailed below is both a chaotic environment where air elementals and air-aligned creatures have taken up residence, and
a fortified sanctuary for an NPC known as the Lord of the Storm.

The Storm itself is a vast thunderhead that rises 12 miles high and stretches 30 miles long. The air itself quivers and vibrates in the presence of the storm; thunderclaps fill the air and lighting flickers and flashes within the cloud.

83610.description:
1861 - First Manassas (American Civil War in 3D)

The first battle in our series of the American Civil War games in 3D sees the Union army under General McDowell meet the combined armies of the Confederation under General Beauregard and General Johnston. The battle is fought just north of Manassas Junction across the stream called the Bull Run. The Union hope for a swift victory to end the war, but a delayed attack by the Union has allowed the Confederates to combine its two armies. The Union still outnumber the Confederates, but only just, so let the drums roll and the flags fly, it’s time for brother to meet brother.

The game can be easily played over 2-3 hours and there is a 16 bound time limit on it. Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game that gives a flavour of the American Civil War period. A simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?
Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit. You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion. The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in four quadrants, the First Manassas six page Battle Report, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice. The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you start this great series of battles with a victory? Play North or South in this the first of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.

>Source: wargamesdownload.com
83610.name: 1861: First Manassas

83611.name: Grachtenracer
83611.description:
User Summary

Grachtenracer is a boatracing game developped by the dutch game developer Davilex. The game is made for windows only.

In Grachtenracer the player has to race through Amsterdam and Venice at full speed. The player can choose between: Championship, Quickrace en Sightseeing.

83612.description:
1861 - Wilson’s Creek (American Civil War in 3D)

The second battle in our series of the American Civil War games in 3D sees the Union army under General Nathanial Lyon make a daring dawn raid on the Confederate forces. The Union are outnumbered more than two to one, but Lyon is banking on his more skilled men being able to win the day. Can the Confederates commanded by General Benjamin McCulloch stop this bold Union action?

The game is quick to play in less than 1 hour, but it is very tactical and can be played again and again. It has a time limit of 18 bounds in which the Union must achieve their objective. Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game that gives a flavour of the American Civil War period. A simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit. You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion. The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in two quadrants, the Wilson’s Creek five page Battle Report, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice. The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you continue this great series of battles with another victory? Play North or South in this the second of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.

>Source: wargamesdownload.com
83612.name: 1861: Wilson's Creek

83613.name: Urlaubs Raser
83613.description:
User Summary

In Vakantie Racer the player and his whole street has won the first price in a streetlottery. They won a vacation on the camping Walhalla in Monaco. But there is one problem, only one place is free for the next 20 years, so now all the people have to race to get that last spot.

The player chooses one of the five characters with who he wants to complete the race. Then they have to start a race in 6 parts from Maastricht to Monaco.

83614.description:
1862 - Fort Donelson (American Civil War in 3D)

The third battle in our series of the American Civil Wargames in 3D sees the Union army under General U.S. Grant laying siege to the Confederate held Fort Donelson. Grant has just come directly with his army from his victory at Fort Henry only a few days prior.

The Confederate General John B. Floyd has held a council of war and it was proposed that the Confederate army should attempt to breakout and head for Nashville. So on the morning of the 15th February 1862 the Confederates prepare for their assault, luck is on their side as General Grant is away from the immediate location of Fort Donelson.

Fort Donelson has a time limit of 12 bounds in which the Confederates must achieve their objective. Its design allows for a fast, fun and realistic game within a 2 hour period of continuous play. The game gives a flavour of the American Civil War period and a simple chain of command solution adds intrigue to the game, keep the chain of command together and everything is fine, lose it and it could cost you the game?

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters, these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit. You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion. The final 3D game board gives you a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

Included with the download is the 3D Game Board in four quadrants, the Fort Donelson six page Battle Report, the Gaming Counters, a simple guide on how to build a 3D Game Board, the Brothers At Arms twenty page Rules Booklet with Playsheet, a twenty four hour Timeline Table and finally a set of Tile Dice. The game rules are fast and easy to learn and will be the same throughout the full series of American Civil War in 3D.

Can you continue this great series of battles with another victory? Play North or South in this the third of the American Civil War in 3D series of board games.

>Source: wargamesdownload.com
83614.name: 1862: Fort Donelson

83615.name: Under the Ice
83615.description:
From opening paragraphs:

This dungeon is located in and below a massive, ancient glacier, which is rumored to have swallowed a whole city in a time long
past. Each tale told of the city is different: some say the city was good, others evil, some believe the glacier that now buries the city was created to protect it, while others believe it was
meant to cage something in.

In your implementation, the secret buried beneath the glacier may not even be a city. It might be a buried temple, a long-lost tomb, an ancient white dragon's lair, or even a sacred spring that grants immortality. What lies beyond the map is left up to you.

Naturally other parties are interested in discovering what lies below the ice for various reasons. Intelligent humanoids are already at work digging through the glacier, and icy predators lurk in its frigid caverns. Even those who have perished while seeking the glacier's secret oppose the efforts of new adventurers.

83616.name: Spawning Pits of the Tomb Bats
83616.description:
From opening paragraphs:

The spawning pits dungeon assumes that the primary antagonist in your campaign is creating tomb bats. These small creatures fly out into the world and animate dead in cemeteries and on battlefields. If your antagonist is a necromancer, or is working with necromantic magic and the undead, then this asset is an easy fit with your campaign.

It is possible to use this dungeon with other kinds of antagonist, as well. The tomb bats could perform some other function, one that serves the needs of the antagonist better – perhaps they spread plague, or they function as spies, or they hunt out magical items or worshippers of a particular god. Perhaps they are not bats at all – perhaps the process creates
specters or flesh golems instead of tomb bats, or some other kind of creature. Perhaps the process creates a new kind of poison, or a new precious metal, or a special kind of food that can be used to turn humans into halffiends. The tomb bats can be adjusted to serve whatever far-reaching goal your antagonist has. This dungeon assumes only that the process relies on a heavily researched technique and that the vivisection of dire bats is required.

83617.name: Alkavan's Bazaar
83617.description:
From the front cover:

20 maps, 27 different structure. Contains:

- 12 assorted shops
- 2 large inns (The Golden Griffin ane The Inn of the 7 Coins)
- A warehouse
- An Assassin's Guild
- A 3-story Bank
- A Merchant's Guild
- A marketplace
- A 4-story museum
- A 9-story library
- An Academy & more

Featuring Bannon Manor, a large, 3-story manor which covers 6 full maps and features architsctural as well as descriptive maps.

Can be used with Fantasy, Medieval, Modern, or Futureworld Game Systems.

83618.name: The Burgundy Pit
83618.description:
From the front cover:

A complete fantsy dungeon adventure!

83619.name: The Vampyre's Mirror
83619.description:
From the back cover:

"We never even saw him... only heard his jeering voice and felt the icy chill of his ever watching stare..." -Alomark

83620.name: Monster Mix Up
83620.description:
From the back of the box:
The Monsters are all mixed up! Can ask the right questions and guess the monster on your opponents card before they guess yours?

User Summary:
A knock-off of Guess Who? that requires players to guess their opponent's secret monster card. Adds some giggly fun to the tried-and-true guessing game when players are forced ask questions such as, "Does your monster have 3 eyes?" or "Does your monster have green skin?"

Comes with:
2 Playing Boards (1 Purple, 1 Green)
3 Sheets of Pre-cut Monster Cards
2 Sets of Plastic Frames and Scoring Markers
1 Instruction Sheet

83621.name: Adventurer (Issue 10 - May 1987)
rpgissuearticle: Making a Mint: Coinage in Scatophagium
Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf?
83621.description:
Adventurer, Issue 10, May 1987
The Superior Fantasy and Science Fiction Game Magazine
Cover art by Steve Vallely

83622.name: Tausend Zahlwörter
83622.description:
The game consists of 50 number cards and 60 numeral cards. There are various ways to play with these, aimed at children with dyscalculia issues, but grown-ups can also play this.
The main rule set requires players to just use the numeral cards. The game starts with one card on the table. Now the players take turns either adding a card from their hand or replacing a card with one or more card(s) from their hand. The only condition is that the numeral on the table has to get bigger each time. A player who cannot increase the number on the table loses a point and the cards are dealt again. The maximum number that can be achieved with the included cards is nine hundred ninety nine thousand eight hundred and ninety eight (which is one word in German).

(User summary by HilkMAN)

83623.name: Go Fart
83623.description:
This game consists of a whoopie cushion and a poker card deck with various names of farts on them.

The farts are graded by the Fart Meter as follows:
2 - Whoopie Cushion
3 - Hand over Mouth
4 - Hand Under Armpit
5 - Hand Under Knee
6 - Loud But Harmless
7 - Foghorn
8 - Tea Kettle
9 - Loud and Odorous
10 - Spotters
J - Forever Fart
Q - S.B.D.
K - The Flamer
A - Atomic Bomb

The game is a Go Fish variant where the person who makes an unsuccessful request for a card, can either draw for the card they need, or they can attempt a fart that matches the card they desire. So if the player asks for a 4 and they are told to "Go Fart", they can draw from the deck or they can do a "Hand Under Armpit" fart, which is what the Fart Meter shows for a 4. Other players judge the fart.

From the back of the box....
If you plan ahead you can really have "a gas" with this game. The have a "leg up" on your opponents be sure to consume large quantities of beans or chili with carbonated beverages.

Object: The object of the game is to be the first person to get rid of all your cards by creating three of a kind or a run of three consecutive numbers i.e. three Spotters (three 10's) or a run of J,Q,K (Forever Fart, S.B.D., The Flamer).

83624.name: Samurai Zombie Nation
83624.description:
Zombie Nation, or Samurai Zombie Nation as the in-game title screen calls it, is a 1990 NES action game developed by KAZe. In Japan, it is known as Abarenbō Tengu (暴れん坊天狗, lit. "Hooligan Tengu"). This game is known for its strange juxtaposition of zombies and samurai.

In Zombie Nation, the floating samurai head, Namakubi, is sent to the United States to destroy Darc Seed - an alien who crashed to Earth via a meteorite and turned all the American people into zombies. Namakubi must recover the samurai sword Shura and destroy Darc Seed and its minions.undefined

Version Differences

Abarenbō Tengu, meaning "hooligan tengu", was released in Japan in 1990 by Meldac. It was then localized outside Japan as Zombie Nation due to the tengu belonging to Japanese folklore not widely familiar with western culture. Aside from having some Japanese text, both games are practically identical, with this game having only a few major differences:


In Abarenbō Tengu, the player must obtain the rapid fire ability. In Zombie Nation, the player starts with it.



The main character's sprite is not that of the flying samurai head, Namakubi, but that of a Japanese konoha tengu head. The title screen is different with the tengu's head being incorporated into it.



The boss of Round I is an evil Statue of Liberty in both games but with a slightly different sprite; instead of being green with snakes in replace of its crown in Zombie Nation, it's red and has a normal crown.


Source: Wikipedia, "Zombie Nation (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83625.name: Tom Clancy's ruthless.com
83625.description:
Turn-based business sim. You take control of a software company and must allocate resources to various areas in order to ensure the total dominance of your company's products. Departments requiring resources include research and development, human resources, admin., marketing and legal. Also, you're not restricted to staying within the law you can resort to industrial sabotage or even extortion and violence. A good tutorial is incorporated in order to help you get the hang of the game. The game is played on a simple grided screen populated with colored squares that stand for various buildings and secured markets. You can chose from a set of six scenarios or an open-ended game. It is also possible to participate in multi-player games on-line. There are multiple difficulty settings adding some replayability value to the game.

Source: The Game Website.

83626.name: Zen: Intergalactic Ninja
83626.description:
Zen the Intergalactic Ninja is a fictional character created in 1987 by Steve Stern and Dan Cote, and initially published under their Zen Comics imprint. In the early nineties Zen was licensed to Archie Comics, and then to Entity Comics. Zen became a popular cult comic inside the comic book community at a time when comic books where becoming more mainstream.

The game

The comic was later adapted into a video game for both the Nintendo Entertainment System and Game Boy in 1993 by Konami. The games feature Zen fighting an alien villain known as Lord Contaminous, who is keen on harming the Earth's ecological environment. The music for the NES game was composed by K. Nakamura and has been played on the Swedish radio-channel P3's programme Syntax Error.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zen Intergalactic Ninja", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83627.name: Shrine of the Sword
83627.description:
User summary:

A high level adventure for not less than 3 PCs.

From the History:

Ava-Terrel, the father of this great kingdom who vanished a millennium ago, was a great warrior (and a wizard although not many know of it). He was reputed to have fought off a whole band of evil orcs armed with only his famed sword, the Myrmidon. His past is dark and shrouded in mystery but under his wise rule the people prospered and did not ask many questions.
On the fateful night of his bicentenial, he mysteriously vanished, never to be seen by his people again.
The legendary Myrmidon, the glowing symbol of this great kingdom, was lost with Ava-Terrel. Its malevolent beauty is now but a memory.

83628.name: Imagine (Issue 24 - Mar 1985)
rpgissuearticle: How to Sell the Ponti Bridge
83628.description:
Imagine 24
March 1985
Adventure Games Magazine

Cover art by Ken Kelly.

Special Thieves Issue!

83629.description:
The Hobbit is a novel that tells the tale of a diminutive hero that, with the help of a group of stalwart dwarves, sets off to infiltrate Smaug’s lair in an effort to plunder the dragon’s vast hoard of treasure. Now it's your turn to take on the roles of the dwarves, aiding Bilbo in his monumental quest to defy the odds and become a legend...

The Hobbit is a board game of adventure and treasure for 2-5 players. On his quest to the Lonely Mountain, Bilbo Baggins will need assistance and guidance from his stoic dwarf companions. As one of these dwarves, it is your responsibility to aide Bilbo on his journey and ensure that you recover the treasure that is destined for you.

Conceived by acclaimed designer Reiner Knizia, The Hobbit features elegant game play, combining strategic card play with the unpredictability of dice rolling. The objective of the game is to be the player who accumulates the most treasure by the end of the adventure. Treasure is won through Adventure Cards, which are drawn when Bilbo enters an Adventure Space. Adventure Cards present players with a challenge that can be overcome by using the game's custom dice.

Bilbo's dwarven companions have three stats that influence their ability to complete Adventures: Cunning, Strength, and Initiative. Cunning allows the player to re-roll dice when resolving Adventure Cards, Strength provides a number of axes to Adventure checks, and finally Initiative determines which player draws the Adventure Card first and how many shields they will contribute to battle.
83629.name: The Hobbit
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episodio beta – El Hobbit y Spiel des Jahres 2011

83630.name: Atlantys
rpgpublisher: SàRL Sans Peur et Sans Reproche
83630.description:
User Summary:

The Atlantys core book contains the game rules, background information and a scenario.

The game rules are simple, using a twelve-sided die roll under a character stat to resolve actions. The biggest part of the rules is the description of the numerous Aesthesic powers, which are split in five groups (Energy, Spirit, Elements, Fluids, Body).

The rest of the book describes the world, its different countries and factions, the evolution of humanity, the equipment available to the characters and the human colonies in the solar system.

The book ends with a scenario taking place in a penal colony on the moon.

83631.name: Steel Panthers: Campaign Disk #2
83631.description:
User Summary:

Steel Panthers: Scenario Disk #2 adds a further 3 campaigns and 40 scenarios to the Steel Panthers base game.

83632.name: City Crisis
83632.description:
City Crisis is a helicopter flight simulator where the player must rescue citizens, extinguish various fires, and aid during natural disasters. There are five different rescue helicopters the player can pilot across 3 different game modes.

Source: User Summary

83633.name: The Rescue of Ardene
83633.description:
From the introduction:

The evil wizard Gregorvich Brownski has captured Ardene, the beautiful elf princess of Silverwood. He holds her on the remote island of Laiah, deep underground. He has a standing challenge to all who dare, to try to rescue her.

Official dungeon for American Eagles Tournament held 24 Feb 1980.

83634.name: Remember Edo
83634.description:
From the text:

Remember Edo is a setting and system hack for Gregor Hutton's brilliant story game "Remember Tomorrow." It is set during the historical Edo Period in Japan, and inspired by fiction, particularly the anime series Samurai Champloo.

83635.name: Extermination
83635.description:
From the back of the box:

"Welcome to the endangered species list.

You're under orders to uncover the cause of a distress signal emanating from a secret military base in Antarctica. Once there, you find the base contaminated by a virus that has ferociously infected and mutated every living and non-living thing in sight. And you're next.

You've never felt pressure this intense. You can't think. Can't blink. It's just you and a tenaciously unstoppable virus bent on infecting the world. You're U.S. Special Forces Recon Marine Dennis Riley, and you're on a mission that seems impossible."

83636.name: Pentology Card Game
83636.description:
From the website. "www.pentologygames.com";

Pentology is an adventure card game. While the core mechanics remain constant, the cards are designed for use in any number of different games. It is most comparable to a standard fifty-two card deck of playing cards. Although it does not have suits and numbers, jacks or queens, Pentology does allow mathematically sound strategy; group, team or solo play; simplicity or complexity; all with the same deck of cards.

Pentology further provides players with a backdrop fantasy theme for every game. With Pentology cards, solitaire games become a mission of saving your allies and defeating your nemesis; poker style games suggest the fun of defining the characteristics of your own hero, and then pitting her strengths against your opponent's; and blackjack feels like a quick skirmish.

Standard playing cards have long been popular because of the vast number of games that can be played with a single deck. Pentology cards boast that same value. Each deck includes a rulebook with rules for five different games, and as creative enthusiasts come up with new game rules and post them on the forum, the list of available games will grow.

With the support of online community, players can continually find new games, contribute their own ideas, and vote on which games to standardize.

83637.name: Trigger Man
83637.description:
From the back of the box:

"Nobody threatens our Family. Nobody.

Don Coladangelo always treated you like a son. Taught you the old ways and codes of the family; do what you gotta do, but protect the innocent and never let the cops get wise. His rise to the top brought about an unofficial truce amongst the bickering crime families. But someone has designs on ruining that peace. Someone killed rival Mon Montagano's son - now he blames Don Coladangelo. Your mentor calls on your loyalty to thwart an attack on him by the Montaganos. It's not up to you to keep this little conflict from erupting into a full-scale street war.

Trigger man puts you in the shoes of the underworld's toughest mob enforcer. You'll have to work fast; all you have are your wits, muscle and brute force."

83638.name: SeaWorld Adventure Park: Shamu's Deep Sea Adventures
83638.description:
From the back of the box:

"The Ultimate Underwater Adventure!

Battle the evil Kraken and Poseidon the sea god!
Thrash & Smash your way to unlocking special powers!
Bravely Duel 1000s of dangerous sea creatures!
Explore the amazing secrets of the Lost City of Atlantis!"

83639.name: The Great Below
83639.description:
Subtitle: Adventure Toolkit in the World of Untamed Isles

Publisher Blurb:
Welcome to a nautical adventure set in the swashbuckling Setward Isles, where Star Shamans navigate submersibles through the uncharted depths in search of the artifacts of the Ancients while naval officers and freebooting pirates do some fancy fencing among the rigging of tall ships.

Inside this book you'll find setting notes on the world of Untamed Empires, an introductory story for beginning characters, ideas for further adventuring, and 75 new feats for the Suzerain rules system. That'll double the number you have from the rulebook alone!

This product is a large PDF download and art intensive. It comes as two pdfs, a high art version and a print-friendly version, both of which are included for the price.

83642.name: Ed, Edd n Eddy: The Mis-Edventures
83642.description:
From the back of the box:

"Join Ed, Edd n Eddy on their Mis-Edventures!

In this tag team adventure game, switch Eds on the fly to take advantage of their unique abilities.

You'll encounter all of your favorite characters from the show as you make your way through the cul-de-sac, scamming the neighborhood kids!

Collect jawbreakers and coins to unlock bonus content"

83643.name: Critical Hit! Issue 1
83643.description:
First biannual issue of "The Independent Journal of the ASL Hobby"

From the table of contents:
Wet Behind the Ears by Russ Bunton
St. Joost in My Mind by Joe Leoce
Enter the Kreigsmarine by Leon Harris
ASL Variations by John Gardner
Scenario Replay by Rob Banozic and Scott Drane
Back to Balta by Ray Tapio and Steven Pleva
Sicily From a Loser's Point of View by Andrea Matteuzzi
ASL Editorial Page by Rob Wolkey and Dave Longworth

Scenarios:
CH1 Authie: The Death of Company C
CH2 The Capture of Balta: August 1941
CH3 The Green Hell
CH4 Steutzpunkt Vierville
CH5 Acts of Defiance
CH6 Armored Probe
CH7 Prelude to Breakthrough
CH8 The Predators
CH9 Breakthrough to Kozani
CH10 Forest Strongpoint

83644.name: Super Bubble Pop
83644.description:
From the back of the box:

"Get your groove on.

Dance to the beat of crazy music and play 150 levels of bubble popping action in this 3d puzzle game. Make your move and work quickly to take out the bubbles before they take you out. With rocking soundtracks and fast-paced game play, Super Bubble Pop will keep you grooving to the beat for hours."

83645.name: Critical Hit! Issue 2
83645.description:
Second biannual issue of "The Independent Journal of the ASL Hobby"

From the table of contents:
The Siberians: Masters of the Russian Winter by Steven Swann
Moyland, Bloody Moyland by Ray Tapio and Steven Pleva
ASL 201 by Russ Bunten
Where Did They Come From? by Robinson and Ruta
Dying by the Half Squad by Robinson and Ruta
Raging Furnace by Michael J. Klautky
Attack on Narrow Pass by Major John F. Schmitt, USMC
Into the Valley by Kramer, Haseler and Bishop

Scenarios:
CH11 Rite of Passage
CH12 Snow Ghosts
CH13 Moyland, Bloody Moyland
CH14 Ninety Minute War
CH15 No Farther
CH16 Out of Luck
CH17 Funnies at Zyfflich
CH18 Raging Furnace
CH19 Into the Valley
CH20 The Hand of Fate
CH21 A Ridge too Far
CH22 Schwerpunkt
CH23 Suffer the Children...
CH24 Those Normandy Nights
CH25 Land of the Khan

83646.name: Ecran (Atlantys)
rpgpublisher: SàRL Sans Peur et Sans Reproche
83646.description:
User Summary:

This contains the gamemaster screen for Atlantys (a 3 panels screen with 3 portraits on the players' side, and tables on the gamemaster side), and a 16 pages booklet.

The booklet includes a scenario where players investigate a revolutionary organization while dealing with political intrigue, corrupt politicians and a racist government.

83647.name: FUBAR
83647.description:
FUBAR is a simple, one page set of rules designed for gaming WWII, Modern, or SciFi combat. Each player has a force composed of a number of Units, each of which in turn includes a number of individual figures, with weapons chosen from a short list of generic weapon types (it's simple to add more or detail the existing ones). A player is allowed to activate his units one at a time until he fails an activation roll, at which time play passes to the opponent. Units which have not moved, or fail to activate, are able to use reaction fire. Movement is measured from a short list of available actions, run, walk, assault, etc. Combat is resolved using a die roll-savings throw mechanic, with saving throws only if the target wears armor. Hits result in Suppression or Casualties, with more experienced units able to take more suppression hits before casualties are inflicted. vehicles are treated generically, but with a choice of armor & weapons.

Force list, weapon choices and vehicle details are left to the player, although fan-produced lists have been posted on the game website.

FUBAR has a range of rules and supplements including these genre:

FUBAR 40K Boarding Actions - Space Hulk and Space Crusade
FUBAR Generic Sci-Fi
FUBAR Stargate1
FUBAR Star Wars - Hoth battle
FUBAR Clone Wars
FUBAR Starship Troopers
FUBAR Steampunk
FUBAR Warhammer 40K
FUBAR Warzone
FUBAR Hammers Slammers
FUBAR Imperial Commander
FUBAR 15mm SciFi
FUBAR Micro FUBAR - 6mm scale
FUBAR Vietnam
FUBAR WW2
FUBAR Afghanistan
FUBAR Horror

83648.name: Radiant Historia
videogameversion: North American Nintendo DS Reprint edition
83648.description:
User Summary

Radiant Historia is a Japanese RPG developed for the Nintendo DS. The game is set in the fantasy world of Vainguer, a land engulfed in a war between the nations of Alistel and Granorg. The entire world is slowly becoming a desert, and each country fights for what little habitable land remains. The game's protagonist is an Alistelan intelligence officer named Stocke, who at the outset is defeated and almost killed by one of Granorg's commanders. He is saved by a mysterious artifact in his possession known as the White Chronicle, which transports him to realm called Historia. From there, he discovers that he can travel backward and forward in time to alter his actions at critical points in the game's narrative.

The game adheres closely to JRPG genre conventions, although all enemy encounters are visible as the player explores and most can be engaged or avoided at will. The player can shift between the past and future, and their actions in the past will alter the situation in later time periods. The battle screen is a 3x3 combat grid that emphasizes strategy, and the visuals present 2D characters on a 3D background.

83649.name: Global Control
83649.description:
DESCRIPTION:
Have you ever wanted to rule the world? Now you can do so -- with Global Control! This is a card game where 2-6 players compete by using power cards and strategy to outsmart and outplay fellow players. Your objective is to take control of countries from around the globe.

Do you save your powerful cards to capture a key country? Do you sabotage your friends? Do you sit back and watch two competitors duke it out and waste their resources?

With eighty different countries and ninety-six power cards, anything is possible.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Have the most points once 20 random countries are owned.

GAMEPLAY:
Players take turns bidding on countries, using 'power cards'. The highest bidder takes control of the country which moves them closer to global domination.

GAME ELEMENTS:
•Players can collect cards and store up additional firepower to control key countries
•Many cards affect the effectiveness of other cards, creating player contention
•Countries provide additional 'special powers' that can be leveraged

83650.name: Paradise Plunge
83650.description:
Two groups of friends meet while vacationing on a tropical island. While relaxing at the local tiki bar, they enter into a friendly wager. They will take to the skies, and each team of friends will race through the tropical skies, plunging by parachute back to the island. The last group back to the tiki bar buys a round for everyone.

Paradise Plunge is a game of strategy for two players who must assemble their teams in the air and reach the island and the tiki bar before their opponents. Players begin with their teams of parachuters spread across the tiles that make up the sky over the island. Each turn, a player may move one of their parachuters, "play the wind" by rearranging the tiles in a row or column according to direction of the wind as marked on the tiles, or rotate one or two tiles so that the wind on those tiles points in a different direction. Movement is complicated by the fact one player may push an adjacent player in the direction of the wind, but may not separate groups of three or four of the opponent's parachuters. The winner is the player to move all four of their parachuters to adjacent tiles with one of those parachuters on or adjacent to the island tile.

83652.name: Heroic Adventures Volume 1
rpgissuearticle: The Oft Bitter Pills: Capsule Reviews
83652.description:
From the Back Cover

Do your Heroes have what it takes?

Heroic Adventures Volume 1 contains three exciting, independent adventures for use with Champions or Dark Champions.

Throwing Stars and Bars takes the heroes through a romping adventure in the deep South. Someone is kidnapping seemingly random people from the Memphis area. Can the heroes unravel the mystery and stop them before it's too late? It's going to take some clear thought and a lot of courage to prevent a very un-civil war!

Someone has taken of the FBI's premier training facility, known as the Block, and is holding the trainees hostage. The heroes must infiltrate the facility and neutralize the threat. As the heroes soon discover things are not all as they appear in The Block.

The heroes enjoy some recreation in a virtual reality system. Is this game merely an escape from the hum drum of everyday life, or an exercise in supervillainy? Can the heroes discover the secret and save the day or will they be put on Virtual Ice?

83653.name: Heroic Adventures Volume 2
83653.description:
From the Back Cover

Taking it to the Streets

Heroic Adventures Volume 2 contains six exciting, independent adventures for use with Dark Champions or Champions.

A maniac kidnaps a wealthy executive's son and is going to blow him up at midnight. Deadly toys rampage through a busy shopping mall. Terrorists are selling nuclear grade plutonium to the highest bidder. A new drug hits the streets and a child disappears near a haunted house, the only lead is a group of neighborhood kids. A seemingly immortal vigilante is killing jaywalkers and speeders. People are dropping dead in the street for no apparent reason.

It's all in a night's work for a Hudson City vigilante.

This book contains six action packed adventures for use with Dark Champions and the Hero System. Test your vigilante's mettle and give your players what they really want -- Heroic Adventures.

83654.name: Heroes & Heroines Rules Guide
83654.description:
From the back cover:

Finally the comic book role play game everyone has been waiting for! Introducing the Heroes & Heroines Rules Guide. With close to life statistics and over 230 powers to choose from, Heroes and Heroines is the perfect system to incorporate your favorite heroes from any comic book company. We've even taken the idea one step further. We currently have on license characters from several major comic book publishers. This will allow you to buy supplements and adventures using characters you read about in comics for quick reference in game play. Also included within is a ready to play introductory adventure.

83655.name: The Maxx
83655.description:
From the back cover:

The Trouble with Julie Gone is an adventure for the Heroes & Heroines Comic Book Role-Playing game. Mr. Gone and the Isz have captured Julie, while in disguise as a pack of Squirrel Scouts. You, the Maxx, must rescue her before she's sacrificed to increase Gone's control of the Spirit World. The statistics for all of your favorite Maxx characters are included within.

83656.name: DeathWatch 2000
83656.description:
From the back cover:

All life on earth will be destroyed by the year 2000, or maybe sooner! You and your fellow heroes are the only ones who stand a chance to defeat the Dragon and the Hellbenders mad scheme to destroy the Earth's ozone layer, thus eliminating all natural life on earth! Are you up for the challenge? DeathWatch 2000 is an adventure supplement for the Heroes & Heroines Comic Book Role-playing Game.

83657.name: Journeys (Issue 1)
rpgissuearticle: A Short History of Amber Diceless Roleplaying
The Gamemaster's Purview: The Mythus SEC Benefits Question
Torg: Building the Possibility Wars One Reality at a Time
83657.description:
Journeys, Issue 1
Journal of Multidimensional Roleplaying

Cover art by Keith Parkinson
Free Lift-Out Poster by Keith Parkinson

83658.name: Медвед
83658.description:
UNAUTHORIZED PRODUCTION



The information that BGG has on this item indicates that Медвед is an unauthorized reproduction of Jungle Speed/Arriba!.




Party game consisting of a wooden totem that is placed between the players. The players then flip up cards from their deck, and when two of the same pattern are turned up, the players with this pattern try to grab the totem.

83659.name: Feats of Subterfuge
83659.description:
From the book's introduction

Not every Pathfinder Roleplaying Game character is built to take challenges on using direct assaults — some prefer subtler methods that focus on stealth, misdirection, and covert maneuvers. The Genius Guide to Feats of Subterfuge contains a collection of feats that provide new alternatives to characters who use duplicity and deception to make their ways through the world, including exactly zero feats that add a +2 bonus to a pair of skills (so we can focus on other interesting options).

83660.name: d∞ (Issue 1, Aug 2010)
rpgissuearticle: How to Properly Age a Document
Prickly Customers, or the Quill Memorandum
Setting the Mood of the Game with Music
83660.description:
User summary

Table of Contents are shown in the Linked Article module below.

83662.name: Florancala
83662.description:
An Oware variant for the entire family

Enjoy the feel of the gameboard, designed in the shape of a blossom.

Florancala is somewhat more tactical than the well-known "Little Stones Game" (BAO), but can easily be played with children from about 6 years on.

Semi-precious stones in the petals are collected and distributed; colored wooden balls in the hollows of the inner circle are used to mark the players' own starting spaces.

Each player may take stones only from his own hollows and distribute them.
If the last stone falls into an opposing petal in which then 2 or 3 stones are lying, the player may take these from the board and lay them down on the table, in front of him.
The player who has collected the most stones in the end wins.

Start in your own hollows - capture only from opposing hollows.

• Solid gameboard in blossom shape, 30 x 30 cm
• 48 semi-precious stones and 32 wooden balls in 4 colors

83664.name: Camino
83664.description:
In Camino players race to complete at least one full round around the board, and then as far as they can get. There's a special die that has to be rolled which dictates moves. Then there are the caminis. Tokens that can be collected and used for various purposes during the game to get an advantage on your opponents.

Taken from publishers website:
The game for sighted AND visually handicapped players

The pieces are colored and can be effectively sensed by touch. They are put in the hollows on the board in such a way that they won't slip out of place. The large wooden die with extra-deep indentations comes with a board that will be appreciated also by sighted people.

Frank Stark has designed a game that is fun to play with the entire family.

A player who believes he is on his final spurt can still be pushed back by a 'stopper' die roll, or an opponent moves your own piece back again - this causes lots of trouble and mischievous joy, no matter whether the player can see or not.

Knowing the way Frank Stark is, it is quite clear that he wouldn't think of just one game for one board - so Camino comes with an additional bonus game and two more variants to choose from.

... And why shouldn't Camino be played also by people who can see but are blindfolded?

83665.name: Magic Boy
83665.description:
From the back of the box:

Little Hewlett is top of his class at Sorcery School. One evening he stays behind to finish some work and accidentally lets the grand wizard collection of crazy pets out of the basement. Can you help Hewlett get them all back before his master returns in the morning? Warning! This platformgame is extremely addictive!

83666.name: The Mask
83666.description:
From the back of the box:

It's smoking!
Once you put this mask on, you can do anything! Dash at the speed of sound! Pull guns and mallets out of thin air! Spin like a cyclone!
And it's a good thing, cubby, because crime boss Dorian Tyrel is going to blow the coco bongo club into next week unless you can get past all of edge city's toughest thugs!
Let's Rock This Joint!

Use all of The Mask's hilarious morphing capabilities
Take a spin through 7 wild edge city locales
Special appearances by Milo the Dog and Cuban Pete

83667.description:
During the second third of the 19th century, a rapid development of railway transport got under way. All over the world, the railway networks were growing and steam engines accelerated the progress. 175 years ago, on December 7 1835 to be precise, the first German train powered by a steam engine started operating between Nuremberg and Fürth, transporting passengers and goods. In England’s region of Wensleydale transport of goods via railway tracks was started 13 years later.
First Train to Nuremberg is a revised edition of Last Train to Wensleydale. You take the role of a railway promoter, backed by the investments of hundreds of local landowners. Your aim is to build lines that can make a profit from the transport of passengers and goods. However, money is not the only resource you require. Many locals will oppose your schemes and only with influence in the government will you be able to build over their land. Your company is far too small to be able to have its own engine works, so contacts with the major operators will help you acquire second-hand trains and rolling stock. You will also need to be on good terms with the two local railway companies. Without their support you will not be able to link to their networks, nor will you be able to negotiate the sale of your lines when they become unprofitable (as they surely will).

With First Train to Nuremberg now two players can fully enjoy this extraordinary train game as well. Instead of cheese and stone, now beer and mail will be transported, besides passengers of course. There is a new challenge when transporting passengers: They can travel first class now and thus you will gain more victory points but on the other hand, you have to buy trains that are more expensive. Additionally, you may benefit from the first connection between Nuremberg and Fürth and receive extra victory points, which may be crucial for winning the game. What’s more, you may play the original game of Last Train to Wensleydale on the flip side of the game board, or almost so. Some slight changes of the original rules work with that map as well as the rules of the first edition.
83667.name: First Train to Nuremberg

83668.name: Laura Jones and the Gates of Good and Evil
83668.description:
From the publisher's site:

The adventure begins when Laura Jones, an assistant to the famous archeologist Dr. William Adams, receives a mysterious letter explaining that Adams had discovered an ancient talisman.

The ancient talisman turns to be one of the keys to legendary gates that safeguard an ancient portal – the source of the sacred powers of Art, Love, Strength, Will, Talent and Knowledge. According to legend, anyone in the portal can control the balance of energy to these sacred powers, which in turn affects everyone in the world. As always, when it comes to things that can control the world, evil is never far behind. After obtaining the first key, the Key of Knowledge, Laura learns that she’s the chosen one and must use portal to restore harmony on the planet.

Before she can enter the portal, Laura must find the six sacred keys to the gates that protect it. In addition to finding each key, she must also prove that she is worthy of possessing them by passing various ordeals prepared for her by guardian spirits of the gates.

Solve puzzles, discover hidden clues, collect the secret keys, prove that you are worthy by passing the extraordinary challenges from the guardians, learn the secret to the Gates of Good and Evil, and save the world from total destruction.

83669.name: The Mystery of the Crystal Portal
83669.description:
From the PC publisher's site:

Embark on a brain-bending adventure that's full of unique Hidden Object fun! Journalist Nicole Rankwist has always been close to her archaeologist father, so when he goes missing, Nicole knows she has to find him! After all, he had apparently just made a discovery that could change the course of humanity. Join Nicole as she searches the globe on an eye-popping quest to find her father and discover The Mystery of the Crystal Portal.

Stunning scenes
Fun gameplay
Save Nicole's father!

83671.name: Mecarobot Golf
83671.description:
From the back of the box:

Who is Mecarobot Golfer Eagle?
His golf is perfect because he hits the ball with matchless power and at angles calculated using data stored in his highly advanced artificial brain. The engineers who created Eagle have an ambition: to participate in a pro golf tournament.
But meeting the resistance of other pro-golfer, they reluctantly drop their plan. Eagles misses the chance to display his ability. Their sponsor buys Eagle a golf course and names it the Hyper Golf Club. Eagle is still waiting for challengers. So let's go to Hyper Golf Club. In this club, you can try three kinds of real plays. (Competition, Lesson, Driving Range) Eagle is looking forward to a match with you.

83672.name: Metal Morph
83672.description:
From the back of the box:

The last thing you remember, you'd just morphed your ship through the interdimensional Hypergate. Now, your body is being experimented on by aliens. Your ship was ambushed and its components spread across the alien galaxy.
You see that these strange creatures are obviously very intelligent and very aggressive. If they unlock your secret of MetalMorphosis, they will be able to cross through Hypergate, putting the home planet, Earth, in serious danger. You know what you must do.
You've gotta morph your ship into new configurations to do battle. You've gotta jump, shoot and morph your body through alien space stations and planets. You've gotta find hidden areas through pipelines, encounter force fields, moving platforms and conveyor belts. You'll need tons of powerups, and you'll find them.

You've got one desperately slim chance to warn Earth. Get morphing!

83673.name: Rally Cross Simulator
83673.description:
User Summary

One of Codemasters's budget games in the 'Simulators' franchise.

Simple top down scrolling racing game with different terrains, like city (paved roads), dirt roads and desert.

83674.name: Metal Warriors
83674.description:
From the back of the box:

It's the year 2102 and the Dark Axis Forces - an intergalactic army threatening to enslave the Earth - are knocking at your door with a plasma-blast greeting. You've got a three ton laser-sword-wielding, energy-cannon-firing, jet-propelled suit of robotic armor at your disposal.

What are you gonna do?

Jump into one of six armed-and-ready battledroid units and blast through over 9 huge missions. Or, if you're just looking for a fight, try the 2 player mode & kick your friend's metallic butt. If you're enough of a METAL WARRIOR to get the job done.


Each battledroid has unique offensive & defensive weapons such as: flame cannons, light sabres, machine rifles, & energy-blasting drones.
Powerups include: seeking bullets, rockets, reverse gravity boots, time bombs & more!
Leave your 'droid at any time & fly around. Find unoccupied battledroid suits to refresh your attack strategies!

83675.name: Robin of the Wood
83675.description:
User Summary

The player is Robin, son of Aleric. According to the game's description, Robin's father is the protector of the Silver Arrow. However, he has been killed by the Sheriff of Nottingham and the Silver Arrow has been captured.

It is up to the player to venture into Sherwood Forest and fight the Sheriff's man patrolling it, to thwart his evil plans and recapture the Silver Arrow.
Simple maze game.

83676.name: Rocket Ball
83676.description:
User Summary

Rocket Ball is a futuristic ball sport game. Can be played versus a computer opponent, or with two players. Teams are rollerskaters on a circular track. On either side in the outer wall is a hole in which the ball can be thrown to score. However, rough play is allowed, so the other team will try to knock players over to get the ball.
Before play 1 of 4 teams can be selected: Houston, Tokyo, Moscow or Madrid

83677.name: Samurai Warrior: The Battles of Usagi Yojimbo
83677.description:
User Summary

Side scrolling action adventure with lots of fighting.
