These and 18 other amazing monsters from Earth's mythic past are available now! Add them your game today and see how your heroes stand up against some of humanity's oldest enemies!

83842.name: Killzone 3
videogamehonor: 2011 Spike Best PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
83842.description:
The game picks up immediately after the ending of Killzone 2 and follows the previous games' main protagonist, Sev, a Special Forces operative fighting for the Interplanetary Strategic Alliance against the Helghast Empire. The game's story has been referred to being similar to the story of David and Goliath. The game continues shortly after Sev successfully defeated Radec and Rico having killed Visari, the Helghast dictator who leaves them to a fleet of Helghast ships approaching them destroying ISA vessels.

The death of their dictator has left the Helghast Empire in a state of internal struggles with political scheming against each other gripping the Helghast Empire. Now, Sev and his comrade Rico are trapped in the cross-fire between the various political factions in the Helghast Empire without any reinforcements and are left to fight alone in order to escape as the ISA struggles to regroup its forces. The game will also give players a deeper look in to Helghan culture such as their language and showcase whatever humanity they have left within them.

Killzone 3\'s story will also be more light-hearted compared to its predecessor, which Guerrilla felt suffered from an overly serious and dark story which was one of the major complaints of the original, though they mentioned that it would not be too light-hearted as it is still a war. In addition, Guerrilla Games has hired an external writer to focus on only writing the storyline so as to give a fresh perspective to the story as well as hiring a lot more Hollywood actors to elevate the level of storytelling within the dialogue of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Killzone 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83843.name: Glinda of Oz
83843.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF includes the original story "Glinda of Oz," written by Frank Baum, and features additional editing and d20 game statistics designed to help the story read more like a d20 game and to help your d20 game play more like an Oz story. In addition to the complete stat-block and profile for the title character, Glinda the Good, this PDF also includes a full stat-block for the Spider King, a formidable monster that attacks Dorothy and Ozma in the first chapters of the story. Furthermore, d20 game statistics are also presented for three powerful artifacts and several other unique magic items that appear in the story. The Wand of Ozma, the Belt of the Gnome King, and the Book of Records are described with full d20 game statistics along with a few more mundane magic items, such as cans of brains. Rules for cooperative spell casting are also presented along with a demonstration by the characters in the story. Furthermore, this book also features 6 illustrations depicting the characters in action.

Whether you are a fan of Oz, an avid d20 gamer, or both, this book is sure to fill a unique niche in your hobby.

83844.name: God Spells
83844.description:
From publisher blurb:

God Spells contains 50 spells for divine casters. Druids, clerics, paladins and rangers can all find useful tools in this assortment of miracles. Plenty of stunning new spells such as pollen cloud, armor of stone, excommunication, and sorghum's wrath are featured among these pages, and are waiting to enhance your game. Mass resurrection is always a crowd-pleaser and the deadly tongue of swords is sure to get any enemy's attention!

God Spells also includes many of the divine spells that have appeared in Bloodstone's other titles, all updated to the new 3.5 rules. Classic spells like convalescence, fortify and spirit of the lion have been retooled with the 3.5 version of the core rules and are ready to be added to your game! With the God Spells in their hand, your divine heroes will have all the power they need to achieve their spiritual goals!

83845.name: Hero's Handbook
83845.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hero's Handbook is packed with enhancements and options for high-fantasy heroes. It contains over 120 new feats, more than 80 new magic items, 12 new prestige classes, 80 new spells and dozens of new inventions of alchemy and craftsmanship. It also features an appendix of bonus material that didn't fit in the other chapters, including a new race and a new class. From sinister weapons and gemstone-plated armor to magical beds and crushing arcana, the Hero's Handbook is essential for any spell-wielding, sword-brandishing band of heroes!

There are over 120 new feats in the Handbook for classes of all sorts. Combat oriented feats including Overpowering Blows, Axe Kick, Serpentine Strike, Armor Expert, Fearless Assault, Best Defense, Cloud Punch, and Ferocious Rage are supplemented by plenty of utilitarian feats such as Linguistics, Apocrustic Endurance, Deeds of Renown, Stance of Redoubt, and dozens of other amazing deeds of heroics.

The Handbook also presents 12 new prestige classes such as the arcane master, battle magi, fabled champion, stalwart defender, demagogue, grand pugilist, combat tactician, and other heroic professions for fighters, wizards, monks, and others.

This supplement is also packed with 80 pulverizing spells of both arcane and divine origin. Arm your wizards with cannonade, chromatic coruscation, parathematic bolt, contumacy, abyssal vortex, shadow cloud, anthropomorphic ward, and other bone-crushing sorceries! With the Handbook, clerics and other devout heroes can add god speed, hellfire and brimstone, dauntless resolve, earth fist, doom shield, battlefield, and plenty of other acts divine might to their repertoires.

The Hero's Handbook also contains more than 60 new wonders of alchemy, herbalism and craftsmanship. Mining spikes, sleeping pills, mage's blend, dragon's bane, sinister weapons, gem-stone plated armor, and plenty of other surprising objects, chemicals, and tools fill these pages!

Furthermore, the Handbook presents 80 new magic items including bracers of battle fortune, blankets of solace, teeth of attack, combat boots, rings of heroism, and dozens of other helms, rings, staves, beds, cauldrons, robes and much, much more!

83847.name: Lords and Legends
83847.description:
From the Introduction:

Much of the material in this supplement has been gathered from the pages of the Hero’s Handbook, published by Bloodstone Press. There is also some information that has been pulled form the Primal Codex and the Book of Broken Dreams, also published by Bloodstone Press.

The four characters (and one cohort) presented here are equipped as standard NPCs (5,600 gp at 6th, 27,000 gp at 12th, and 150,000 gp at 18th level) and include background and personality
descriptions. The background and world-specific content is merely for flavor. The facets of each personality have been determined with the rules for personality found in chapter 2 of the Book of Broken Dreams.

83848.name: The Gamin
83848.description:
From opening paragraph:

Gamins typically come from the lower social class. They fill many different roles in society, but most are primarily interested in the easy life. They prefer civilized lands, prepared food and comfortable beds. They have learned how to live off the benefits of society without giving their own fair share back. Sometimes viewed as the lazy, burdensome elements of society, gamins often have careers as gamblers, hustlers, small time con artists, pick pockets, and worse. A few gamins are of a more benevolent disposition and work as spies, scouts or guides.

83849.name: Random Encounters: Rabid Monkey Troop
83849.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rabid Monkey Troop is a fully detailed random encounter designed for a typical group of 5th-7th level adventurers. While traveling through the wilderness, the heroes are attacked by a mob of rabid monkeys who use group tactics to overwhelm the heroes. Faced with more monkeys than they can hope to kill, many which are foaming at the mouth, a great deal will depend on the players being able to stay calm when things start to look grim. This encounter includes d20 statistics for four types of advanced monkeys, many of which are infected with rabies. It also features detailed rules for the rabies virus and includes some suggestions for possible peaceful resolutions to the encounter. Like all supplements in this series, this PDF includes information on. the background and terrain modifiers of the encounter, the monster's tactics, and possible ways for the heroes to gain bonus experience points from this encounter.

83850.name: Random Encounters: Roadblock
83850.description:
From publisher blurb:

Roadblock is a fully detailed random encounter designed for a typical group of 7th-9th level adventurers. While traveling through the wilderness, the heroes encounter a massive dinosaur carcass blocking their way. There are other travelers held up by the roadblock as well, and they look to the heroes for help. Unfortunately, the carcass is massive, there is a monster lurking inside it, and it is lying on the edge of a cliff. As the heroes confront the monster, chaos breaks out among the NPCs, doubling the heroes' difficulties. This encounter includes maps of the local area, d20 statistics for an advanced otyugh, and rules for the very dangerous environment the characters will have to fight in. Like all supplements in this series, this PDF includes information on. the background and terrain effects of the encounter, the monster's tactics, and possible ways for the heroes to gain bonus experience points from this encounter.

83851.name: Random Encounters: The Hunt
83851.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hunt is a fully detailed random encounter designed for a typical group of 6th-8th level adventurers. While traveling along a country road, the heroes encounter a horrible magical beast that is rapidly depopulating a small hamlet and the surrounding countryside. Everything depends on their ability to track the beast down, out smart it, and kill it before it kills everyone in the valley. This encounter includes maps of the local area, a new template for Enchanted Creatures, d20 statistics for an advanced dire enchanted panther, and detailed description of how to pit the characters in a desperate race against time where hundreds of lives hang in the balance. Like all supplements in this series, this PDF includes information on. the background and terrain effects of the encounter, the monster's tactics, and possible ways for the heroes to gain bonus experience points from this encounter.

83852.name: Spellbinder's Sourcebook
83852.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Spellbinder's Sourcebook contains 50 arcane spells. Wizards, sorcerers and any other arcane caster can find dozens of useful and innovative spells within these pages. Amazing new spells such as creeping shadows are presented for illusionists. Horrible new necromancies like vampiric youth and death shadow, which plagues the target with a life-draining parasite are also included in this collection. There are also spells designed for transmuters such as Invulnerability and acid reflex attack. There are several spells that manipulate the flow of time in this collection as well. Spells like time leap, time stall, and time sense can give a caster control over the most powerful force of all--Time. There are many new spells for diviners, conjurers and evokers in this collection as well. For example, the deadly 8th level spell entropic blade is a powerful conjuration that inflicts excessive suffering on lawful creatures.
The Spellbinder's Sourcebook also features several original spells that first appeared in the Primal Codex and the Book of Broken Dreams. These spells are revised and updated to the 3.5 version of the core rules and feature several adjustments and clarifications These spells include many of the most useful and original spells from those titles such as encumbering load, instant karma, salty wounds, giant strength, hand of doom and others.

The Spellbinder's Sourcebook also features a new template, the war beast. Two new spells are included that relate to the war beast template, one that creates the war beasts and one that summons them. A sample war pig is included as well.

83853.name: Spellbinder's Sourcebook Vol. II
83853.description:
From publisher blurb:

This second volume in the Spellbinder's Sourcebook series contains 50 arcane spells of dark and destructive power. Half of these spells are brand new and the other half are selected from Bloodstone's other publications, such as the Hero's Handbook. The transmutations and evocations in this collection have been selected for their impressive effects and broad utility. They are guaranteed to bring fresh and exciting new options to your d20 game.

The Spellbinder's Sourcebook II contains 25 new arcane spells such as cry of damnation and blood sweat and tears, which causes subjects to suffer from bleeding, fatigue, and blurred vision. This volume also features new spells like speed of the wind and goblin horde for casters that prefer a more indirect method of defeating their enemies. There are also utility spells in this volume such as diminish and speed of the wind, which can assist a group of adventurers in many different ways.

Volume II of the Spellbinder's Sourcebook also contains 25 of the most creative and interesting spells from the Hero's Handbook and the Book of Broken Dreams, all presented in d20 3.5 format. Useful and impressive incantations such as abyssal vortex, snow blind, and storm door have been re-edited and are included for your gaming pleasure.

Many of the spells featured in this collection are transmutations, but there are also quite a few evocations as well. Several illusion and conjuration spells can also be found in this book along with a few spells from other schools such as necromancy and divination. There are spells that alter the subject's body, such as ooze form, and spells that alter the functions or abilities of objects, such as grappling rope and awaken object.

83854.name: Bag of Tricks
83854.description:
From the introduction:

Ever found (or thought about buying) a bag of tricks but didn't want to prep all the required stat blocks or carry yet another heavy book to the game? Bag of Tricks banishes these problems! This PLAYER'S RESOURCE contains detailed write-ups of all three versions of this iconic wondrous item including full stat blocks for all animals that can be called forth from the bag.

Each bag also benefits from two optional intelligent item add-on packages that provide extra powers and interesting roleplaying opportunities. Designed to easily fit into a character folder, each bag of trick entry benefits from a two-page spread containing all the information a player needs to use this interesting, versatile item.

83855.name: The Golden Liberation Society
83855.description:
The second Living Glorantha adventure.

From the adventure overview
The characters have all been called together by an invitation to join the Golden Liberation Society, a prize any sane man within the Empire would covet; such invitations do not come easily. The players realise that membership of the Society will come at a cost, but the benefits are surely greater than any cost that they must pay.

83856.name: Etrian Odyssey III: The Drowned City
83856.description:
Etrian Odyssey III: The Drowned City​ (世界樹の迷宮III 星海の来訪者, Sekaiju no Meikyū Surī Seikai no Raihōsha, lit. "Labyrinth of Yggdrasill III: Visitor from Star Ocean") is a 3D dungeon crawler role-playing video game by Atlus for the Nintendo DS. The title was released in Japan on April 1, 2010 and in North America on September 21, 2010. The Etrian Odyssey series is well known for its old-school style and difficult adventures. Players play the role of a guild leader, adventuring into the labyrinth to fulfill quests.

Source: Wikipedia, "Etrian Odyssey III: The Drowned City," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83857.name: Shadow Falling
83857.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some Things Are Not Meant to Be Found
The siren's call of the Council Ruin beckons relic hunters, xenologists, and the brave. She holds secrets buried away for ages and treasures of which man can only begin to dream. The greatest of all her secrets and the most valuable of all her treasures is an object so powerful an entire civilization fell to protect it. But nothing can stay hidden forever....

In Shadow Falling, the PCs come into possession of a map suggesting that something of great importance lies in the belly of the mysterious Council Ruin, an alien structure that predates the arrival of the humans. As they endeavor to recover the object, they will have to overcome dangerous obstacles, from the rival Black Wheel Gang to the shadow-shrouded vaasi to the ruin's own PL9 defense system. However, if they can retrieve it, and escape with their lives, they will have done a great service to all humankind. Then again, the end is just the beginning.

Shadow Falling is a stand-alone adventure using the Future d20 System for characters of 4th to 6th level. The adventure is set on the planet Eos from the Dawning Star campaign setting, nominated for an ENnie for Best d20 Game. However, it can be used in most any d20 science-fiction setting and includes extensive conversion notes. It also features:

6 detailed encounter maps
A dozen fully described side treks and optional encounters
2 full pages of printable counters
New xenomorphs and alien relics

83858.description: High Ground 2 is a new Battlepack from Bounding Fire Productions that includes the best of the original High Ground release from Heat of Battle. From the original pack, the 2 unique map boards that make up the hill are included, and 7 of the original 8 scenarios have been updated. BFP has expanded on the original product with 9 new scenarios, two new challenging map boards, and a specialized half-board castle overlay.
83858.name: High Ground 2

83859.name: Sonic Chaos
83859.description:
Sonic Chaos (known as Sonic & Tails in Japan and Sonic the Hedgehog Chaos in Europe) is a platform game for the Sega Master System and Sega Game Gear, developed by Aspect and published by Sega in 1993. It was the last platform based Sonic game released for the Master System in Europe.
The Game Gear version was re-released in 2003 as a hidden game in Sonic Adventure DX for the Nintendo GameCube and PC and as an included game in Sonic Mega Collection Plus on the PlayStation 2, Xbox and PC. In 2009, the Master System version was released on the Virtual Console.
Sonic Chaos is notable for the fact that it is the first 8-bit Sonic title to feature Tails as a playable character, and also the first in the series to allow the player to manually control his flight. A sequel titled Sonic Triple Trouble (Sonic & Tails 2 in Japan) was released in 1994.

Source: Wikipedia, "Sonic Chaos", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogame: The Best of Windows Entertainment Pack
83860.name: Pipe Dream
videogamecompilation: The Best of Windows Entertainment Pack
83860.description:
Pipe Mania is a puzzle game developed in 1989 by The Assembly Line for the Amiga. It was ported to several other platforms by LucasFilm Games, who gave it the name Pipe Dream and acted as general distributors for the US. In this game, the player must connect randomly appearing pieces of pipe on a grid to a given length within a limited time.

The Windows version of the game was included in the MS Windows Entertainment Pack. In 1990 it was released as an arcade game by Japanese manufacturer Video System Co. Ltd., though with slightly altered gameplay, giving the player the task to connect a source and drain with the random pipe pieces.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pipe Mania", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83861.name: Turbo-Team
83861.description:
The marathon-camels are warming up, the hurdle-kangaroos are jumping up and down, the lively frogs are stretching their legs, and off they go!

Team turbo is a dice-powered animal race game with pigs, camels, frogs and kangaroos. Every player has his/her own individual racetrack. Goal is to be the first player finish the whole team while avoiding obstacles which slow you down.

83862.name: RoboCop (1988)
videogamehonor: 1989 Golden Joystick Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
83862.description:
RoboCop is a 1988 run and gun/beat 'em up hybrid arcade game developed and published by Data East with permission from Ocean Software. Other reworked versions appeared for home computers and video game consoles, most of them handled by Ocean, as well as a NES version ported by Sakata SAS and published by Data East. It has more recently appeared on mobile phones.

The games capture the spirit of the RoboCop film to some degree, as it involves killing generic criminals and enemy bosses, like the dangerous ED-209. Being quite popular, RoboCop was followed by several sequels (most of them handled by Ocean), including RoboCop 2, RoboCop 3, and RoboCop versus The Terminator which was developed for, but never released in arcades, and was later ported to several other consoles including the Sega Mega Drive, Super NES, Nintendo Game Boy, Sega Game Gear, and even as a final generation title for the Sega Master System in Europe.

Source: Wikipedia, "RoboCop (video games)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83863.name: Silkworm
83863.description:
Silkworm is a classic side scrolling shooter, developed by Tecmo and first released for arcade in 1988. In 1989 it was ported to the Amiga, Atari ST, Commodore 64, ZX Spectrum, Amstrad CPC and NES (1990) systems by The Sales Curve and released by Virgin Mastertronic.

Silkworm had interesting graphics and relatively fast-paced gameplay. The player can take control of a Jeep mounted with a machine gun or a Helicopter mounted with forward and downward firing guns. Two players can work simultaneously and cooperatively against enemies, with one playing as the Jeep and one as the Helicopter.

In single-player mode, it is generally easier to play with the Helicopter than with the Jeep, but it can be more fun to play as the Jeep. As the Jeep, the player needs to destroy everything directly in front of it or be prepared to jump in order to avoid collisions. In two-player mode, the Helicopter and Jeep must cooperate, and the players depend on each other to succeed. For example, the Helicopter can only fire forward, so occasionally, the Jeep must cover the rear with his swiveling gun. However, when covering the rear, the Jeep is vulnerable from the front, so the Helicopter must cover him.

The players collect shields, power cells which increase fire power and an additional bonus can be added to the score achieved. The game gets harder on the completion of each level. The game employed some destructible environmental elements, such as buildings and ancient ruins. Silkworm featured a background music theme composed by Barry Leitch. It had sound effects.

Source: Wikipedia, "Silkworm (game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83864.name: Forge of Imagination: Spark of an Idea
83864.description:
From publisher blurb:

The time comes in the life of every campaign world when the Game Master runs out of ideas. Typically it comes sooner than expected and far sooner than desired. Whether it is because the players are moving in an unexpected direction or simply because as Game Master you are burned out from everything else you have been doing, you need to come up with something or scrap the campaign.

The Forge of Imagination contains both fleshed out ideas and "sparks" to spark your own creativity and give you a helpful push in the right direction. Based on decades of professional experience designing role-playing games and worlds, this book strives not just to list some plots and ideas, but instead to teach you how to develop the sparks on your own. This is another of Board Enterprises' "Simple and Sane" supplements that gives you what you need to work and teaches you how to expand it on your own. Keep your imagination fired, while we give you ideas and pointers on how to generate your own ideas with a lot less wear and tear on your mind. Players will be happier, and you as the game master will be happier and more rested.
This supplement contains:

over two dozen campaign starters
over 150 adventure ideas plus 10 adventure starters
more than five dozen twists to convert old ideas into new ones
about 80 quick or random encounters

83865.name: Signs & Portents (Issue 84 - Sep 2010)
83865.description:
From the publisher's site:

In this month's issue;

Traveller
A Traveller special this month, with a veritable fleet of new ships, all complete with deck plans!

Earthdawn
A selection of bizarra flora and fauna that clever adventurers may be able to put to use...

Traveller
How to inject a little horror into your games.

Chthonian Stars
A brand new preview of this exciting new setting for Traveller!

83866.name: Ankriddle’s Exotic Shop of Words
83866.description:
From the Introduction:

This shop is designed for anyone who wants to provide scholars, wizards, nobles, lore masters etc. with a full-fledged library resource. The shop is best suited for a large city that houses educational facilities and several factions of nobles and political parties. In the following pages you'll find the personalities who run the shop, several example tomes, assorted grimoires, as well as the layout of the shop itself and some interesting tidbits to make the shop truly come alive as a place your players want to visit again and again.

83867.name: Gallop Racer 2006
83867.description:
Back of the box

Gallop Racer 2006 is as thrilling to play as it is easy to understand. Whether it's competing against legendary horses, creating the winning team of horse and jockey or capturing the "Dream Cup", Gallop Racer 2006 has something for the horse racing fan in all of us.

83868.name: Bartholomew's House of Curiosity
83868.description:
From the Introduction:

This shop is an oddity to say the least. It's designed to be a catchall for DMs who want to provide their players with 'one-stop shopping.' That's not to say that Bartholomew's will always have what the players want but a crafty DM can guarantee that what
Bartholomew's does have at any given time will certainly be something to remember.

83871.name: G1 Jockey 3
83871.description:
Back of the box:

The Action and Excitement of Thoroughbred Racing!

Start as an apprentice and race to the elite G1 class! Compete for the best rides. Learn racing tactics from veteran jockeys. Work your horse into top form, set a racing schedule, and ride to victory!

83872.name: The Seventh Sin: Ale & Boarding House
83872.description:
From the Introduction:

Virtually every campaign city possesses a motley collection of taverns where adventurers can rest up between exploits, meet with their contacts and fences, or find information and/or work. The Seventh Sin is one such watering hole, designed explicitly to be easily dropped into most campaign settings (or at the very least, those with a medieval pseudo-European bent.)

83873.name: Powers of Light Book 1: The Magisters
83873.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Darkness Rising series continues with Powers of Light: Magisters.

The first in a series of volumes detailing the forces of good in the Great War, Magisters are the wizards of the powerful alliance of light. Spellcasters and wardens of peace, the Magisters are an ancient organization, filled with secrets, mysteries, and age-old pacts.

Able to cast back darkness with their mystical Wands and Staffs, the Magisters are a shining beacon of light in a world of growing shadows.

Become a Magister, take up the Light of your Order and protect the night against the rising menace of the undead. Become a mystical vampire slayer, a bringer of peace, or a sentinel against the rising brought by the Void - the terrible power of death and darkness.

83874.name: Zombies
rpgissuearticle: Review of Lords of the Night: Zombies
83874.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play zombies in any setting, beings with mystical powers and even greater secrets.

With new powers, abilities and an entire setting that can easily be incorporated into any game, The Lords of the Night: Zombies adds a new look at the age-old zombie and as with previous books, the night will never be the same again.

You have flesh-eating zombies, new magical diseases, FULLY playable zombies, plus an awesome new type of arcane necromancer.

As with all new Bottled Imp Books, there are plenty of new playable creatures in this book, including:

New Zombie Types (playable character types)
The Alchemical Zombie (creatures reanimated through the highly addictive Serum)
The Eldritch Zombie (magic-draining creations of terrible power)
The Ether Zombie (creatures made from the souls of the living)
The Golem Zombie (Frankenstein - only taken to Bottled Imp's limits!)
The Mock Zombie (what happens when resurrections go back)
The Revenant Zombie (when the promise of revenge passes over into undeath




A truly unique book filled with all the grotesqueness and horror you have come to expect from Bottled Imp Games' line.

Become one of the Risen, take up arms against your mortality (or chase after it!).

83875.name: Tridio
83875.description:
Tridio is an abstract educational game to help developping spatial insight.
It helps to see the relationship between 2D and 3D objects.

The game is developed by Productief BV and used in schools in the Netherlands.

Game is played by building a structure on the board, each player sitting at another side of the board (so another view on the structure). Everybody is building the 2D view from there side of the board.

By selecting a cube, and rolling the dice. 1 cube will be moved. Before the actual move. Every player should update his 2D view as it would look like after the move.

Tridio Basisspel is the first game in the Tridio series.

83876.name: Memphis Belle
83876.description:
User Summary

This rules set, rather wordily subtitled A preposterously simple game (low on technology, high on empathy) about the American Daylight Bombing Campaign against Germany 1942-45 lives up to its billing.

The game requires only a few dice, a few playing cards, some player-created handouts, and a little imagination to play. Players go through simple pad and paper missions to see how hard it was for a bomber crew to survive a tour of duty.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #81 (June 1994)

83877.name: Beyond Monks: The Art of the Fight
83877.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is more to Martial arts than the monk! Beyond Monks brings the exitement of the martial arts to your campaign. It covers a wealth of player options, including:

The martial Artist, a new core class
More than a dozen new prestige classes
Over 100 new feats

83878.description:
From the Introduction

"The Thousand Bomber Raid is a participation game based on a Lancaster Bomber raid on Hanover on 14 October 1943. It is intended to be played with about 10 players and 1 or 2 Umpires, in less than 1 hour. Each player is intended to fly one bomber; however it is quite possible to have 2 or even 3 players for each bomber. The maximum number of bombers a single Umpire can handle is about 10.

User Summary

For a small rules set, this has some intriguing and innovative features. Physical tasks are required to make certain checks during the game. For example... pilots are required to toss a prop joystick up in the air and catch it in order to perform tasks and engineers must assemble small Lego patterns under time pressure to repair components. The Umpire shines a powerful flashlight in the eyes of pilots while they are performing tasks if they are "caught in search the searchlights."

Navigation is an especially important feature of the game, both for purposes of finding the target, and for staying with other bombers so as not to make easy prey for German night fighters.

Each bomber needs to be represented by a miniature. Game requires d6s, copies of various printed charts and maps, a dartboard along with distinctive darts for each player, a flashlight, a thick dowel (or other prop joystick), and some Lego (or similar) building blocks.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #91 (April 1995)
83878.name: The Thousand Bomber Raid

83879.name: Fast Attack: World War II Coastal Warfare Rules
83879.description:
From the Introduction

"In recent years, the war on the "Narrow Sea" has grown steadily in popularity, with several commercial rules sets being available, along with a wide variety of high quality models, mainly in 1:600 scale. However, being an awkward sort, I'm not happy with the rules currently available. The main reason for this is the scale at which commercial rules operate. They're all designed for squadrons of boats with relatively little attention being paid to detail in terms of individual vessels. These rules are intended to fill in the gap left by commercial sets, and enable you to fight actions in which each vessel is an 'individual.' They're best suited to games with no more than one or three boats per player, as any more tends to result in the game being too slow, and measurements are given in inches.

User Summary

Rules set covers Movement, Gunfire, Damage, Fires, Sick-Berth Attendants, Depth-Charges, Torpedoes, Damage Cards, and the use of the Models/Miniatures.

Required for play: Ship Models (1:72 scale or similar), charts from the rules, a playing surface with a map or terrain, a set of polyhedral dice (d4, d8, d10, d12, d20, d100), string, and a simple set of damage cards (instructions to create these are include in the rules).

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #94 (July 1995)

83881.name: U.S. Ski Team Skiing
83881.description:
Skiing (released as U. S. Ski Team Skiing) is a sports video game produced by Mattel and released for its Intellivision video game system in 1980. Up to six players compete individually on either a downhill or slalom course to see who can complete the course the fastest. For the game's initial release, Mattel obtained a license from the U. S. Ski Team and used its name and logo in the game's box art.

The object of Skiing is to complete the chosen course, either downhill or slalom, in the fastest time possible. Play begins by selecting the number of players for the game. Each player will have three heats in which to post their fastest time for the course. With multiple players, players take turns in the same order for each heat. Next, the players choose from one of 15 levels of steepness for the course, with higher numbers representing steeper (and thus, faster) courses. Lastly, the players select either the downhill or the slalom course for their race.

Players control their skiers by using the controller to turn them until they reach the desired direction. The skiers will accelerate down the hill automatically, based on the steepness of the course. Players may take turns gradually, or by pushing an action button they may take a turn more sharply. Pushing another action button will cause the skier to jump over obstacles on the course, such as moguls.

On both courses, players must successfully pass through a number of gates on their way down the course, with gates on the downhill course spaced farther apart than those on the slalom course. Missing a gate adds a five-second penalty to a player's race time. As each player begins their race, the current fastest time is displayed at the starting line, with their final time displayed after the player crosses the finish line.

Source: Wikipedia, "Skiing (Intellivision game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83882.name: Orbiter: Space Flight Simulator
83882.description:
User Summary

Orbiter is a FREE and realistic space flight simulation program for the Windows PC.

Designed by Dr. Martin Schweiger, Orbiter is a real-time 3D spaceflight simulator. It is one of the most robust public-access spaceflight simulators, and the program is designed to engage less experienced users. Orbiter realistically emulates the physics of space travel, and is accurate enough to recreate historic space voyages. The program allows for fictional spacecraft to be used well, and these craft can present easier flight controls for new users.

The Orbiter exploration zone spans the entire solar system and includes the Sun, the eight planets, and all major moons. Smaller objects such as comets, asteroids, and dwarf planets are not included in the base program. The flight simulator permits sub-orbital, orbital, and interplanetary maneuverability. A time compression option is included to reduce dead time in longer voyages.

The simulator is very flexible, and a large amount of user-created content is available for download. Material includes custom spacecraft, minor bodies that exist in our solar system, new Multi-Function Displays (MFDs), and even complete solar systems (both real and fictional). A scenario editor is available which allows players to design missions that make use of custom vessel capabilities.

See the Web Links section below for the Orbiter download link.

83883.name: Neptune
83883.description:
User Summary

Neptune is a Playstation 3 game published by Sega. The game is a tongue-in-cheek reference to the video game industry, with a number of video game consoles and games personified as characters in the game. The game takes plays in Geimugyokai (lit. Game Industry), a fantasy world broken up into four regions: Platetume, Rinbox (Xbox 360), Lastation (PS3), and Ruwii (Wii). Neptune is the game’s amnesiac heroine, and she finds herself needing to defend the world against the evil goddess Majikonne. The name Neptune is in homage to the Sega Neptune, an add-on for the Sega Saturn.

Gameplay follows the standard turn-based RPG format, and combat has 3D character models in 3D settings. Players can customize Neptune’s appearance and abilities, and can also summon “Guardian Angels” from actual games or from pictures in the PS3 photo album. In addition to the four regions of Geimugyokai emulating consoles, there are goddesses that protect each region which are personified versions of their console. Game companies also have character avatars, and a number of old Sega characters appear in the game.

83884.name: LittleBIGPlanet 2
videogamehonor: 2011 Spike Best PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Nominee
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Winner
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Game Design of the Year Nominee
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Innovation of the Year Winner
2012 British Academy Game Awards Best Multiplayer Game of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Best Online Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Winner
2012 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
83884.description:
User Summary

LittleBIGPlanet 2 is a sequel to the popular LittleBIGPlanet. The game continues Sackboy’s adventure from the first game, and an inter-dimensional vacuum appears over LittleBigPlanet and begins to suck up everything. Sackboy is saved by “The Alliance”, and he joins them in their quest to stop “The Negaivtiron” from destroying Craftworld.

Gameplay is similar to in its predecessor, with many of the levels being 2.5D platforming stages. Unlike in the first game, however, players can now create different types of levels including racing stages and puzzles. The game allows for an unbelievable amount of customization, allowing players to create levels, bosses, music, characters, movies, and everything in between. Also improving on the original game, LittleBIGPlanet 2 features new enemies, themes, toys, powerups, and machines. The player can even rewire the controller to suit their needs in a stage they have created. Any customizable content can also be found and used online using the new search system.

83885.name: Shadow World Atlas (Second Edition)
83885.description:
From the back cover:

The Shadow World Master Atlas contains:

- Information on races and creatures inhabiting the world
- Demons and artificial beings
- Complete Rolemaster Statistics
- Huge 3' X 4" Color Map
- Supplemental Spell lists
- Personalities: background & statistics
- Pantheons of gods & their followers

And in this Second Edition:

- 80 pages of additional material
- New interior art and layout
- Notes on the continents of Emer and Jaiman
- An updated, expanded timeline
- Detailed index
- Evil gods and malevolent cults

83886.name: Conan: The Tower of the Elephant
83886.description:
From the developer's website:

As Conan, you scale the mysterious Tower of the Elephant, fighting vicious enemies and avoiding deadly traps, to finally reach the captive Yag-Kosha and the evil Yara. The game features stunning graphics and an open, mission-based gameplay where every mission will take you deeper into the world of Conan.

”Conan: Tower of the Elephant” is a new gaming experience for iDevices. The game uses Dogtown Studios’ proprietary iPhone 3D engine A2SA and features HD graphics. Using the retina display, iPhone 4 users will experience the best possible gaming experience.

83887.name: Solitaire (1990)
83887.description:
User Summary

This is the basic Solitaire that comes automatically installed on every Windows system since Windows 3.0. It is a version of Klondike.

83888.name: Medieval Naval Warfare Rules
83888.description:
From the Introduction

"I produced these in order to allow for naval actions within a small scale c.1200 A.D. mythical Mediterranean campaign, which will include Christian, Byzantine, Near Eastern, and North African states. However, I believe that they would be very suitable for use in pure naval/pirate campaigns from as early as 800 up to 1500 A.D.

These rules are designed to provide a relatively fast, easy, and basic style of the game. In order to achieve this end the number, types, and operating details of the ships included has been strictly limited. 15mm or 25mm figures may be used ... Dice needed: D6, average dice = 2,3,3,4,4,5, & D10."

User Summary

Players must construct or scratch build models to hold the 15-25mm figures used in the game. (Figures must fit on the deck space of the ship without overlapping.)

Rules set covers movement, initiative, wind direction/force, rams/collisions/shears, missile fire, running aground, grappling, & melee combat. Rules also come with an appendix on medieval paint schemes and another on medieval flags & banners.

Rules set appears in Wargames Illustrated #120 (September 1997). (These rules are somewhat more elaborate than those typically found in a magazine.)

83889.name: Muzundrum
83889.description:
Muzundrum is a game of creating musical triads and scales by placing 12-sided musical dice on a hexagon-based playing board.

From the publishers' website:

Muzundrum is a crossword-style game of music theory developed by composer J S Kingfisher. Players interlace 12-sided musical dice to form scales and triads on a giant honeycomb, forming unique tonal weaves... it’s great for beginners, challenging for pros, and always mind-bending fun!

In the box

21 Twelve-sided Musician’s Dice
The Honeycomb Gameboard
Embroidered dice pouch
Instruction Booklet

Number of players, time required

Muzundrum can be played by 1 to 4 musicians of any age (see “knowledge required” below); or by 2 to 4 teams of musicians (playing in teams allows musical novices to learn from their more experienced partners). The average game lasts 15 to 30 minutes.

Object of the game

In Muzundrum, players intertwine triads with scales, rather like a musical crossword puzzle (albeit a three way one). Triads are built vertically; scales are built diagonally. Points are earned as players add to or complete triads and scales; double and triple scores are earned when dice are played in the “honeypot” cells (the ones marked with 2’s and 3’s). The game is over when all of the dice are played; points are then tallied, and the player or team with the most points wins.

Knowledge required

A basic working knowledge of key centers, major scales, and triad construction is needed to play Muzundrum – all stuff taught in first-year Music Theory classes and by most private music instructors. In addition to being a heap o’ fun, Muzundrum is quite educational: it’s a great way to become fluent in all 12 keys.

83890.name: Capes, Cowls and Villains Foul Quickstart Preview
83890.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Imagine, if you will, a superhero role-playing game that emulates how comicbooks actually work. When comic writers sit down to pen a story, they don't have a character sheet in front of them that defines precisely what the characters can do... how strong or agile they are, what skills they demonstrate, what the exact parameters of their powers are.

Instead, they give the characters what the story demands of them. If the story requires the power-armored hero to have stealth armor, he'll most likely have it on hand. Should it be critical that the hero with the magic amulet needs to generate a mystic shield, you can almost bank on her getting it. Does the hero with normal human strength desperately need to lift a gargantuan chunk of concrete off of his ally? Chances are, he'll be able to muster up the power to do so. It all comes down to what makes for a more entertaining story.

Capes, Cowls and Villains Foul, takes this fully into consideration by offering a game system that is open-ended and flexible, treating the players and Game Master like comicbook writers rather than just some people playing a game. The sky really is the limit... so why not soar through it like the hero you've always longed to be?

83891.name: White Knights, Black Hearts
83891.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Can you dig this much action?

"White Knights, Black Hearts" is a WILD TALENTS adventure about street-level superheroes in world-class danger. It's the sweaty summer of 1975, and you play the Talents who keep an eye on the troubled neighborhoods where the big city's official superheroes, the White Knights, can't be bothered to stick their noses. But that all changes when a little girl gets killed and YOUR team is at the top of the list of suspects.

Now you've got the cops and the White Knights on your tail while you try to figure out who really killed that little girl. And the deeper you dig, the uglier it gets.

The streets have never been meaner.

"White Knights, Black Hearts" includes six pregenerated characters ready for play, and guidelines for bringing your own characters to the streets of Red Shore.

83892.name: Ship Simulator 2006
83892.description:
User Summary

In Ship Simulator 2006 the player can steer different contemporary ships like a container vessel, yacht, small container ship, inland cargo ship, harbour patrol ship, tug boat, tower boat or taxi boat. Lastly, the player can be captain of the RMS Titanic (yes, the famous one) and of all ships present in the game, this one is the most elaborate, allowing the player to walk around on several parts of this virtual (partial) rebuild of it's historical counterpart.

This is not an arcade game but a simulation. Meaning, that when operating the bigger ships, it can take several seconds to notice any change in course after turning the wheel, like it does in real life.

The game ships with 3 real life harbours: Rotterdam (The Netherlands, and besides being one of the biggest harbour in the world, the home of the developing compagny), Hamburg (Germany) and Phi Phi Islands (Thailand). It features 40 missions in which players much steer a boat either as fast or accurately as possible, of course without causing any damage.

83893.name: Ship Simulator 2006 (Gold Edition)
83893.description:
User Summary

Same game as Ship Simulator 2006, with the addition of the New York harbor, 20 additional user created missions (on top of the 40 stock missions) and several video tutorials and trailers of the game.

83894.name: Mystic Empyrean: Core Game Book
83894.description:
From the publisher:

Mystic Empyrean is a vast and unique Role Playing Game that focuses extensively on social character development, world building, and shared storytelling.

Players in Mystic Empyrean take on the roles of Eidolons, beings of power who wear their souls as a skin. Eidolons take a shape granted by their personalities, which alter both their forms and powers. Cruelty may bestow the power to kill with a touch, while Charity can give one the power to create new life from scratch, and Cowardice can cause an Eidolon to shatter like glass when struck.

The Mystic Empyrean Player's Guide contains all the information players need to create Eidolon PCs, grow their world from scratch, and play out adventures within it.

83895.name: The Official Ship Simulator 2006 Add-On
83895.description:
User Summary

This add-on for Ship Simulator 2006 brings the player a number of new ships, like a speed yacht, fishing boat, classic yacht, multi-purpose cargo ship, Russian tug (there is a tug in the stock game; this one is slightly different) and a cruise liner. Additionally, there are 20 new missions to accomplish.

83896.name: Ship Simulator 2008
83896.description:
Game site:
Ship Simulator 2008 is a realistic simulation game that puts players at the helm of some of the most varied and detailed ships to be found at sea. Players will need to perform a multitude of tasks, all set within a realistic 3D environment, taking control of a wide array of ship types - from massive cargo ships and ferries, to speedboats, yachts, water taxis and even the mighty Titanic.

* Dynamic ocean waves, with realistic ship motions
* Long distance travels , open ocean voyages between ports
* Extensive day, night, and weather systems
* Sixteen ships, each with walkthrough functionality and interactive bridge controls
* Thirty new complex and challenging missions
* Free roam mode, Mission editor and Multiplayer functionality

Source: The Game Website.

User addition
As of version 1.3 the game supports multiplayer

83897.name: Ship Simulator 2008 Add-on: New Horizons
83897.description:
New Horizons is the official expansion pack for Ship Simulator 2008. Try your hand at sailing a luxury cruise liner & a classic yacht or feel the impact of the waves as you guide your fishing vessel home through a storm! New Horizons offers new highly realistic environments and adds eight exciting new vessels for your sailing pleasure. Includes all new missions and free roaming multiplayer mode too!

Source: The Game Website.

User Summary
This add-on expands the waters with Cornwall and Padstow. It further features 8 new ships and 20 new missions. Also other options in walkthroughs and, for instance, the option to connect and disconnect a barge from a pushboat.

83898.name: Ship Simulator Extremes
83898.description:
Ship Simulator Extremes is the revolutionary latest game in the best-selling Ship Simulator Series. Almost three years in development, the game raises the bar for accurate and fun simulation gaming. Featuring a completely new and visually stunning ocean system, advanced dynamics and weather system, more vessels and environments than ever before and full campaign missions based on real captain's stories. Ship Simulator Extremes is the definitive simulator for any virtual ship captain and a high quality addition to the acclaimed series.

* Includes many famous harbors and locations from around the world. From the very hot to the very cold, sail to the extremes. Explore the Antarctic or take in beautiful Bora Bora.
* Wide range of vessels to captain, including hovercraft, Coast Guard interceptors, mammoth tankers, tugboats, luxury cruise liners, fast inflatable boats and many others.
* Includes exciting storyline campaigns and shipping missions from all over the world.
* Save the environment campaign: sail famous Greenpeace ships and take part in ecological missions. Sail the brand new Rainbow Warrior III in all its glory, a full year before the actual vessel launch.
* Revolutionary water and weather system. Sail calm waters or take on the most extreme weather ever witnessed at sea, visualised in stunning high quality 3D.
* Online multiplayer mode. Sail online with your friends.

Source: The Game Website.

83899.name: Cinema Vérité
83899.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

This is a lean and quick Role-Playing Game. It's heavy on collaborative storytelling and very light on rules. Like the film style it takes its name from.

Cinema Vérité the Game is missing a lot of the trappings of its older, more complex siblings. There is no thick omnibus of powers or setting information. There are no charts, weight tables, or extensive lists of weapons and gear. Enough about what the game doesn’t have, what it does have is a task resolution that requires only a pair of 6-sided dice that can be found damn near anywhere. It has extreme versatility; capable of adjusting to any setting or trope you care to stick to it.

This game is also very mobile. The film style the game takes its name from is able to move to locales normal film productions just can't. Hollywood requires hundreds of people and tons of equipment and props to get a set ready for filming. CinemaVérité is able to tell its story with a single shoulder camera and small sound rig. This game shares that same portability. All you have to do is grab a pair of six-siders, some scratch paper and a pencil or two and you can set up a game anywhere. You might want to bring along a couple of friends as well, or else you'll find yourself in a corner booth at your local diner talking to yourself. No one really wants that kind of attention.

83900.name: Ship Simulator 2008 (Collector's Edition)
83900.description:
User Summary

The Colector's Edition of Ship Simulator 2008 comes with the base game, the New Horizons add-on, a 70+ pages Captain's Journal of references (printed in the UK release, on the DVD in the Dutch release) and a making-of video.

The Dutch version has, over the UK release, an additional 2 missions featuring the SS Rotterdam.

83902.name: Twenty-Four
83902.description:
Source: The Game Website.

TwentyFour is an addictive new iPhone game based on a classic math card game! Use the four given numbers with +, -, x and ÷ to make 24.

Hours of fun! Great for keeping your mind sharp with mental math!

Test your skills today!

Features:

Timed play - race against the clock!
Free play - try to solve them all!
Peer to peer - challenge a friend!
Online single and multi-player high scores
Solutions available if you get stuck.
Available for the iPhone and iPod Touch
Highly addictive and fun!

83903.name: Zombie Flick
83903.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Be Quick or be Dead
Zombie Flick, an addictive arcade experience for players with tasty brains.

It’s the 1970s, and a devastating, incurable virus has spread through all 49 states of the continental United States of America. With no food or guns available, it’s down to you as the lone survivor in a small town to make the local undead masses feel the pain.

Using nothing but useless everyday objects, you must use your flicking skills to dismember and decapitate all that come at you if you want to survive! Wrapped up in a rich, atmospheric cinematic style, Zombie Flick provides a fresh – and bloody – experience to players worldwide.

83904.name: Runan (Issue 40 - Mar 2007)
83904.description:
Main feature in this issue is a campaign setting for the RPG Vampire and an article on the use of RPG as a part of the education within the Swedish church.

Table of contents (In Swedish)
2 - Ledaren

3 - Prag-krönikan del spelmaterial till Vampire

26 - Moralpanik? funderingar kring rollspelens påverkan av

27 - Favorit i repris: Vakna

28 - Rollspelens svenska historia, kapitel historiska redogörelser

83905.name: Aero Squadron
83905.description:
A two player game where you and your opponent both print separate plans (8 1/2 X 11) with 15 airplanes aiming at each other. You tape them together facing each other, and then take turns shooting at each other!

Although it looks like simple fun at first, it soon becomes Chess like strategy!!!

Can I hit one of his bombers with my first shot? Can he hit one of mine with his first shot. Should I start taking out his small blockers? Offense or Defense? What is your strategy. Small Scout Planes = 20 Points
Medium Fighter Planes = 50 Points
Large Bombers = 70 Points.
B1 Bomber = 90 points
Keep shooting until you have no shots left!

From Game Designer

83906.name: Galaxy on Fire
83906.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Galaxy on Fire is a Multiple award winning sci-fi adventure with spectacular 3D graphics and a terrific story set in huge galaxy to explore!

- 3D intergalactic shooter game with a complex trading system
- Gigantic galaxy with hundreds of planets and space stations
- Gripping story with lots of dialog and 3D-animated cut scenes
- 10 unique spaceships to choose from that can be upgraded with dozens of weapons, shields, drives, etc.
- More than 20 hours of exciting game play

As mercenary Keith Maxwell, you are hired by Admiral G. Smith of the Terran Space Fleet for suicide missions. You receive your own small spaceship as your first payment. Your mission is to help the humans in battles against the bloodthirsty Vossk alien race. Of course the other fighter pilots are not exactly happy that you are joining them as a soldier, and there are many rivalries among the pilots.

At first you will have to perform menial tasks such as clearing space trash near the base station. But the cute female fighter pilot Christine seems to like you and quickly promotes you to help her in difficult missions. You two have to work together as a team to escort transport fleets and fly missions against the Vossks. Over the course of the story, you will also continuously meet dubious characters who sometimes have questionable but extremely lucrative assignments for you.

You are allowed to keep the goods you capture during your missions for yourself and sell them at the space stations and on planets, which allows you to quickly upgrade your spaceship with more powerful weapons and shields or buy a better spaceship in order be able to fight the Vossks...

With its spectacular 3D graphics, a gripping story, an extensive trading system and over 20 hours of exciting game play, Galaxy on Fire™ sets benchmarks in the field of mobile phone games and has been given top marks by all the test magazines for mobile games.

83907.description:
Your goal in Assist is to guess the chosen word, and on each turn you have a choice: ask your question or give your answer. Atthe same time, you're trying to "assist" other players in losing their chips by guessing a hidden word before they can.

Each round, one player draws an illustration card that shows six words on it, chooses one of those words, and tells all players which number he has chosen; each other player receives a hand of three question cards, then antes one chip into a central pot. (Question and illustration cards have text in Italian, English, German and French.) On a turn, a player either plays and reads a question card – which the player who holds the illustration card must answer as honestly as possible – or tries to guess the word hidden on the card. Before a player guesses, he can ante any number of chips into the pot. If no one else matches his ante, he claims all the chips in the pot without having to guess the word; if at least one other player antes, he must give his guess, winning the pot if correct.

When a round end, the next player chooses a word from an illustration card and the game continues. When one player runs out of chips, the game ends and the player with the most chips wins.
83907.name: Assist

83908.name: i Sniper
83908.description:
User Summary

You play a sniper in a anti-terrorist unit. A building has been taken over by terrorists, who've taken the emplyees in the building as hostages. It is your job to save the hostages.

83909.name: Runan (Issue 39 - Oct 2006)
83909.description:
Highlights in this issue is an article with backgroud material for the RPG Gondica

Table of contents (In Swedish)
2 - Ledaren

3 - Vidonias tidiga historia spelmaterial till Gondica

8 - Sverok har fått ny förbundstidning

9 - Favorit i repris: Svenne slänger ett öga på Döden kåseri

10 - Från idé till läsare fansinmakartips

12 - Kolossal heroism spelartikel

15 - Flera spelledarpersoner... samtidigt?! rollspelsbetraktelser

16 - Rollspelens svenska historia, kapitel 3 historiska redogörelser

83910.name: Liches (D&D 3.5)
rpgissuearticle: Bradford Ferguson Review Lords of the Night
83910.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Arcane Liches, creatures of incredible power are the guardians of Creation, the force of imagination and dreams. This book allows you to play a Lich, use the ancient power of Sorcerae and struggle towards enlightenment.

This original 128 page book with mind-blowing art also has a bonus 4 page FAQ to really clarify just what it means to be an Arcane Lich.

Use Sorcerae, the power to change reality with the power of thought alone, and face the terrible evil of the Void, risking your mortal mind in the process.

Everything you need to become a guardian of Creation is right here in this book.

user comment
updated for d20 System / OGL Product (D&D 3.5 Compatible)
for the d20 System / OGL Product (D&D 3.0 Compatible) print edition see Liches (D&D 3.0)

83911.name: Vampires (D&D 3.5)
83911.description:
From publisher blurb:

The lords of the night are coming! For too long they have hidden in shadow. But all that is about to change. With new powers and abilities - the lords of the night have just one thing in mind, the total enslavement of the mortal races.

Whether you want to play a vampire in your favorite fantasy setting, or test the mettle of your players with new and incredible creatures born of nightmares. Everything you could possibly need to rule the night is right here in this book.

This book contains entire rules for playing Vampires, plus exciting information on all aspects of vampire society, from Avystervan, the vampiric city of graves, to vampire weapons, it's all here in this book!

The Lords of the Night: Vampires has seen a major edit with clarified rules and expanded vampire information and a considerable amount of new art. It has been revised for Dungeons & Dragons 3.5 edition.

user comment
updated for d20 System / OGL Product (D&D 3.5 Compatible)
for the printed d20 System / OGL Product (D&D 3.0 Compatible) publication see Vampires (D&D 3.0)

83912.name: Runan (Issue 38 - Dec 2005)
rpgissuearticle: Med en karta hittar man alltid rätt...
83912.description:
Highlights in this issue includes gaming material for the old RPG Wastelands and an article on lifestance in RPGs.

Table of contents (in Swedish)

2 - Ledaren

3 - På äventyr i filmens värld filmpresentation

4 - Wastelands of the Living Dead spelartikel

7 - Med en karta hittar man alltid rätt

8 - Dominus illuminatio mea, eller: livsåskådningar i rollspel rollspelsteoretisk artikel

15 - Pressgrannar tidningsrecensioner

16 - The Story Lab Saga, eller: att utveckla berättandet kåseri

18 - Rollspelens svenska historia, kapitel 2 historiska redogörelser

83913.name: Cannon Cadets
83913.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Game Description
Cannon Cadets, the physics game from the people that brought you #1 hits Little Metal Ball and Marine Sharpshooter! 80 beautifully illustrated levels, addictive gameplay and lots of re-playability are just a few reasons why Cannon Cadets is the new must have game!

The Cannon Cadets Story
Not that long ago, in a galaxy not really very far away, a group of heartless scientists, driven by greed and a desire for power, carried out unrelenting experiments on a little monkey named Gordo. Each experiment chipped away at Gordo’s friendly demeanor, leaving him hardened and bitter. In a high-risk experiment to test a new type of rocket booster, Gordo was blasted into space. The rocket misfired and crashed on a nearby planet where both the experiment and Gordo were abandoned and soon forgotten.

Gordo’s despair and anger became all encompassing and the beauty and happiness of the world around him only fueled his rage. Using everything he learned as a science experiment, he built an army of robots with the goal of making the rest of the world as miserable as he was.

Gordo now travels the galaxy, rounding up those most joyous and happy, trapping them in cages and leaving them behind, guarded by his robot minions. But one happy little boy has escaped Gordo’s grasp. Armed with a rocket and fueled by fun, the little RocketBoy is building an elite force called the Cannon Cadets. You must help RocketBoy free his friends so they can restore fun to the Galaxy and show Gordo how to have fun again!

83914.name: Runan (Issue 37 - Sep 2005)
83914.description:
Highlights in this issue includes two articles with RPG settings. One is a general fantasy setting the other is Call of Cthulhu inspired.

Table of contents (in Swedish)

2 - Ledaren

3 - Anakronism eller trivialitet?

4 - Röd snö äventyrsplats i fantasymiljö

10 - Pressgrannar

12 - Snövit tomhet äventyr fritt efter Call of Cthulhu

24 - Äventyrsspel, ett åttiotal i rollspelens värld kåseri

83915.name: The Adventures of Captain Can
83915.description:
"An exciting game for 3-6 players aged 7 to adult. Pit your wits against the evil Vandalan and his faceless helper Wannabe, as they try to wreak havok on planets Earth, Candoof, Canneri, Hedonia, Mystican and beyond. Only you, as Captains Can and Tinn, armed with belts of ingenious can gadgets developed by Professor Quantum on Planet Gadgetron, can save the day. Will you be the first to overcome Vandalan on his barren home planet, Destructon, and transport him back to earth to face The Wise Ones, or will you encounter the moving hazard Viroid on the way and lose your valuable protective Glittering Whirlwind? There are 12 missions and so many variables that this is a game that will hold you enthralled no matter how many times you play it" Source :- Captain Can News Transmission 1993 flyer.
Each player is dealt a "Mission Card" and, using a "Canmobile" playing piece, races around a board with an hexagonal grid showing various planets with movement controlled by means of a spinner which also causes collection of "Fortune Cards". At the end of the turn the Canmobile must face the direction intended for the next move. All movement [1 to 4 spaces] must be taken in full except when arriving on special marked spaces when cards may be picked up which may help or hinder the player's mission. The Mission consists of collecting 4 gadgets and delivering to a specified planet before anyone else.
Also included with the game is a 12 page booklet, "THE STORY OF CANS - from 1810 to the present day". This game was produced as a promotional item for the Canned Food Information Centre , Birmingham, UK and CarnaudMetalbox plc, Worcester, UK

83916.name: Fingerzilla
83916.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Fingerzilla is a fast-paced, explosive game of utter destruction. Using your own finger(zilla), rain fiery chaos down upon buildings, cars, and people. The interface is simple, but the joy of squashing your boss is priceless!

Fingerzilla includes:
* Dozens of destructive combos to unleash destruction on the masses.
* Named victims to making chomping all the more fun.
* Rampage through a suite of levels of varying difficulty and duration.
* Scores and stats of all kinds, saved permanently between games.
* OpenFeint 2.4 support for online high scores and achievements.
* Variety of buildings to smash into rubble.
* Incredible B-movie sound and visual effects!

83917.description:
The final expansion to the Dragon Age : Origins series until the release of Dragon Age 2. Picks up play roughly a year after the death of the Archdaemon from the original game where your character goes in search of the beautiful, yet enigmatic Morrigan who's parting words to the Grey Warden were "Never follow me...".

Source: The Developer Website.
83917.name: Dragon Age: Origins – Witch Hunt

83918.name: Castle of Dr. Brain
videogameversion: North American DOS 3.5” Disk edition (original release)
videogamefranchise: Sierra Discovery Series (Sierra Entertainment Educational Games, US)
83918.description:
Castle of Dr. Brain is a video game of the educational genre released in 1991 by Sierra Online. The object of the game is to successfully navigate the puzzles Dr. Brain has set up in order to become the mad scientist's assistant (a position Dr. Brain had advertised in the local classified section).

Source: Wikipedia, "Castle of Dr. Brain", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83919.name: Scattergories Categories
83919.description:
If you loved the game of "Scattergories" then Scattergories Categories is the next game you will want to play. It's a great twist on your favorite. Keep the fun coming with this fast-thinking categories game. Contains 125 cards, containing 250 word challenges, 2-minute sand timer, 4 pads of score sheets, plastic card base and rules.
In this game, players take a word written vertically, and brainstorm a word that starts with each letter in that word. For example if the word was FOOD, Frankfurter, Olive, Oatmeal, and Dumplings.

New edition with 250 new word challenges was published in 2016.

83920.name: DeathSpank: Thongs of Virtue
83920.description:
User Summary

Thongs of Virtue is a sequel to DeathSpank. The gameplay is a hybrid of action RPG and traditional adventure, and very similar to the previous game. The game is longer than its predecessor: There are more missions and the world map is larger than before. Several of the map locations have their own subtheme like western, science fiction, war, or pirates, for example.

83921.name: Monty Python & the Quest for the Holy Grail
83921.description:
From the CD:

Burn the Witch! Battle the Black Knight! Then outwit the bridgekeeper at the perilous Bridge of Death in this enchanting interactive medieval experience - the first to earn an enthusiastic thumbscrews up from Vladimere the Impaled! Collect clues and solve puzzles as you join King Arthur and his band of knights on their quest for the Holy Grail. And, as an extra, top-secret bonus, this game includes an exciting, never-before-produced scene from the script of the original Monty Python film.

83922.name: Runan (Issue 36 - May 2005)
83922.description:
This was the first edition of Runan available only in electronic form.

Highlights include a module for the RPG Viking and several Lord of the Rings related articles.

Table of contents (in Swedish)

2 - Ledaren

3 - Pressgrannar

5 - Tolkiensällskapen och Ohlmarks den Förskräcklige artikel om Åke Ohlmarks

7 - Den er go hemsidestips

8 - Nyöversättningen har anlänt! artikel om den nya Lord of the Rings-översättningen

11 - Ringens krig på ett bräde brädspelsrecension

12 - Könsroller i rollspel rollspelsteoretisk artikel

14 - Gunnes gård modul till Viking

22 - Personligt med Krister Sundelin

83923.name: Championship Manager 2
83923.description:
Championship Manager 2 is a football management computer game in the Sports Interactive's Championship Manager series. It was released in September 1995 for PC - it was originally due to be released much earlier but the release date slipped several times as the developers refused to ship the game before it was completely ready. There was also an Amiga version in 1997.

Source: Wikipedia, "Championship Manager 2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

83924.name: Empire of Satanis
83924.description:
From the Game's Introduction:

Empire of Satanis, EoS, strives for innovation. I tried to go outside the role-playing box with this virgin effort. The layout is minimalist and garage band; it's all about the words on the page. It's akin to Lovecraft on an acid trip hurriedly transcribing the insanity of Hell as he falls deeper into the Pit.

New Stuff: The Game Master, GM, is more of a first among equals rather than an insurmountable force directing the players. The players and their characters will have a hand in creating the setting, mood, and activity of each gaming session too. The GM may set the stage, have a few non-player characters at the ready, and have an idea of a possible outcome for the session... but in EoS it is the characters that motivate the story.

Players run characters called Fiends that are part alien, demon, and human. The ambitious fiends who are consumed by the will to power may advance and shape the conquered worlds to their black heart's desire. The ones who fail will be cut down, preparing the way for new and stronger extra-terrestrial devil things. This is the will of the Crimson God Satanis! Characters can live a somewhat restrained existence within their home universe called Yidathroth. Within its hellish borders civilization flourishes; a balance is struck between Fiends, also known as the brotherhood. Ominous sorcery has replaced the technology predominantly used in the old universe, Sha-la.

videogame: Ultima Underworld II: Labyrinth of Worlds
83925.name: Ultima Underworld I & II
videogamecompilation: Ultima Underworld II: Labyrinth of Worlds
83925.description:
From the CD:

Both parts of the best first person 3-D role play adventure to date on one CD! Walk, run and swim through huge multi-level dungeons, fighting enemies, casting spells and solving puzzles.

83926.name: Pooyan
83926.description:
User Summary

The player is a pig, protecting little piggies from the wolves. The wolves attack by floating down in balloons. Shooting the balloons will let the wolves plummet to their death. If, however, they land safely, they can come at you.

The first level is about home defense.

In the second level the pig takes the offense and goes wolf hunting at their lair.

videogame: Ultima VII Part Two: Serpent Isle
Ultima VII Part Two: The Silver Seed
83927.name: The Complete Ultima VII
videogamecompilation: Ultima VII Part Two: Serpent Isle
Ultima VII Part Two: The Silver Seed
83927.description:
From the CD:

All four huge chapters of the award winning Ultima VII saga on one CD - the ultimate role play adventure. Full screen view. Dynamic cinematic soundtrack plus digitised speech and sound effects. Totally mouse driven interface.

User Summary

The Ultima VII: Complete Edition was sold in the Serpent Isle box with a sticker on the front cover stating "more than 200$ worth of software" and describing the content of the box as including all four parts of Ultima VII: The Black Gate, Serpent Isle, Forge of Virtue and The Silver Seed. Another sticker on the bottom of the box saying "Ultima VII Complete Edition" describes the system requirements and recommendations.

It includes all the manuals from Black Gate (Felloswhip, Install Guide, Player Reference Card), Serpent Isle (Beyond the Serpent Pillars, Install Guide, Player Reference Guide), Forge of Virtue (Installation and Quickstart, A Guide to the Isle of Fire) and The Silver Seed (Installation and Quickstart, Play Guide) as well as the two cloth maps but no trinkets.

Ultima VII: The Complete Edition comes on 15 3.5" 1.44Mb Disks and is not to be confused with the "Complete Ultima VII" which has been released in 1994 on CD-ROM, one year later than Ultima VII: The Complete Edition.

Ultima VII: The Complete Edition is not rated but Origin has voluntarily rated the game "MP-13 (For Mature Players)" which probably should have meant PG-13 according to the MPAA guidelines.

83928.name: iDetective #3: The Tragedy on the Train
83928.description:
iDetective is now ready with it's third intallment in the awarded game book series: "The Tragedy on the Train", introducing some new timeoriented gameplay.

You find yourself on the journey of your life as you travel with the beautiful old steam train St. Mary. Soon you are entangled in a plot most devious. It will require more than you can imagine figuring out what happens in the Tragedy on the Train. So lean back and enjoy the ride.

Based on the awardwinning board game, Sherlock Holmes: "Consulting Detective", iDetective presents a new downloadable case in the series every month. This standalone version comes complete with eveything you need to play:


Rules
Case Introduction
Location Entries
Quiz
Solution & Answers
MP3s of Author reading the Casebook and Solution.


Fund it here:
http://igg.me/p/72198?a=455812

83929.name: Call of Duty
83929.description:
From Preface:

The paladin class has captured the imagination of players since its introduction. The paladin is the most difficult class to play, not because of a lack of combat power, but because of its roleplaying restrictions. Many players would like to play one, but are afraid to try.

However, a well played paladin is worth the extra effort. Why is this? The other classes are fun to play because of what they can do. The paladin is fun to play because of how they do it.

The call of duty sets paladins apart.

But it’s also something else. In the real world, we could use a few wizards to make our lives easier or clerics to heal our sick. However, we need heroes more than anything, and paladins are the epitome of heroic fantasy.

In those dreary times of real life that happen in between games, try to live your life a little more like a paladin.

Focus on how you accomplish your goals a bit more, rather than the bottom line.

Don’t let fear run your life.

And never make a deal with a dragon; smite the beast.

Version 2.0: This version is compatible with the revised 3.5 rules.

83930.name: The Book of Qualities, or Half -Feats
83930.description:
From Introduction:

Besides the fighter and the mage, feats are gained rather slowly for other character classes. Some GMs have resorted to handing out feats more often in order to get more use out of them. However, this creates imbalances and robs the fighter of their uniqueness.

This supplement suggests a means for characters and GMs to reach a compromise. Most feats give a sizable boost in power. Qualities, or half-feats, divide that power and distribute it more evenly. Thus, instead of receiving a sudden boost, qualities give an incremental advantage. Why bother? It might not matter so much at high levels, but at lower levels that extra little oomph does make a difference. They also show the gradual development of a character, rather than a sudden jump.

83931.name: Of Sages and Sorcerors
83931.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to Of Sages and Sorcerers, the first of the Legacies series of d20 sourcebooks by Children of the Grave Press designed to expand upon the known and friendly territory of your current game and push the limits of what you had only dreamt of before.

Herein you find new rules and material to energize your arcane spellcasters. From the mysterious powers of the Shadow Sage to the labors of an Arcane Craftsmen, you will find this tome packed full of everything you need to add a new dimension
to your character.

83932.name: Plot Twists
83932.description:
From publisher blurb:

Plot twists... a chance for game masters to introduce the unexpected in to an adventure and keep players on their toes. In this product you will find 150 plot twists that can be introduced into an adventure at any point. Plot twist vary - one twist may offer a small increase to the challenge of an encounter, whereas another could easily change the entire direction of an adventure.

83933.name: Modern Naval Conflicts: 1970s
